payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Committed and trustworthy John M. from Ntungamo is a married man with a sense of development. He is a teacher by profession and he is also operating a shop business from his agricultural enterprise. This has always seen him earn 127,785 Ugandan shillings as net profit on a monthly basis.

He is seeking this loan to help him buy more land as he looks at attaining fixed assets for his family. He believes by doing this, he will be able to build his home, be in position to develop his family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of land

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is a married woman aged 33 years with two children, who are 6 and 9 years old.  Both of her children go to school. Patricie’s husband is a driver.

Patricie owns a shop that deals in selling a variety of items, such as sugar, matches, salt, etc. Patricie has been in this business profession for seven years now. 

She intends to use this loan to increase her initial capital by buying more household items for her store. She intends to use the profits to construct a commercial premise and become a wholesaler. This will put her in position to sell large quantities of goods to her customers.

loans.use: Buying household items for her store

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is a married woman who is 35 years old. She has four children who are between 4 and 15 years of age. She is married to a businessman and their four kids all go to school.

Julienne owns a small shop where she sells household items. With this loan, she hopes to reinvest in her business by buying more household items and by buying beans, which she has not sold before. She is also thinking of having a bar in the future when she gets more profits in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying more household items for her shop

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is a widow aged 50 years. She is a tailor and has done this business for three years. She expects to use the loan to buy more fabric to sew clothes and to sell these clothes to her clients.

Vestine also intends to buy two more sewing machines and hire two girls to help in her business. With the loan, she will broaden her business and be in a position to generate more income.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine for employees

loans.name: Chris

texts.en:
Chris A. from Ntungamo is a hardworking married mother with a sense of developing herself in the near future. She is a teacher by profession and has been doing this for a long time, though she is also into the farming business. This has always seen her earn 202,000 Ugandan shillings as net profits on a monthly basis.

She is seeking this loan to help her buy more land where she can practice her crop-growing enterprise of ground nuts and beans. She believes by doing this, she will be able to earn more income from her produce and be in position to develop her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Buying a plot of land to practice agriculture

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has four years of experience working as a car blacksmith. He is a relatively new business owner; he has been running his own shop since 2007. He is specialized in repairing car bodies. He works independently in his business. With his business income, he supports his father, in collaboration with his brother, with the family expenses.  

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business. This will be his second loan and he is asking for a bigger amount because he said that such amount will meet his project needs for the coming year. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.en: Baktygul M. is a resident of Tup, a nice town in the Isykul region. She is a 55-year-old widow. She has raised two daughters and a son. The first daughter and the son work in Bishkek in a sewing workshop and the second daughter helps her mom with the business. In 1998, because of the high unemployment rate, Baktygul started her own business. She began to sell convenience goods. In 2002, she opened her own store and now she sells convenience goods, clothes, soaps, etc. In this way, she makes 8000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Baktygul wants to increase the turnover of her business and purchase a variety of drinks, foodstuffs and clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business, open a big store and build a house in Bishkek. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of drinks, foodstuffs and clothes

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en:
Badamtsetseg L. lives with her three children in the Chingetei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband works overseas, her daughter works as a salesperson in the Sodon Suvd market and her two sons attend the 24th Secondary School of Chingeltei district. 

Badamtsetseg operates a food retailing business out of a small shop near her home. She started a food retailing business in 2001 at a small mobile stand. Over the years, she has worked hard to build a stable business operation and has gained much experience and expanded her small stand to a food shop. Now her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT), including the equipment and food supplement sold at her store. 

Her business is very important to her and her family. Her daily sales reach to approximately 150,000 MNT. She says, "My only wish is to enlarge the business and save money for my children's further education." 

Badamtsetseg is an open-minded, easygoing and hardworking woman who is good at accounting. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for her business and to repair her food shop roof.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta T. was born in Vanadzor and is 60 years old. She now lives in the city of Ijevan and is a widow. She has a daughter and a son. Her son works and lives in Russia with his wife and children. Her daughter is married and lives separately from her mother in Ijevan. 

Since 1994, Greta has been engaged in clothing trading. She rents a stall in Ijevan’s central market, where she sells the clothes. She buys her goods from Yerevan, Turkey and Georgia and resells them in Ijevan. 

Greta works hard but says she is able to make a living from her trade. She uses the profits from her sales to support herself and help her children live a better life. She is seeking a loan of 600,000 Armenian Dram to increase her variety of clothing in anticipation of the start of the school year in September.

loans.use: To increase the variety of clothing offered

loans.name: Saimumin

texts.en: Saimumin S. is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of detergents, like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream and washing powder, and many other foodstuffs in his store. Saimumin is not alone in this business. His wife actively helps him with sales. Today, Saimumin is requesting a loan of $3,000 to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Saimumin’s main goal is to educate his beloved child so that someday he’ll become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing detergents for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Kantai Ole

texts.en:
Kantai Ole P. is 27 years old. He is married to Nairoshi Enole P. and he is a father of two school-going children. 

Kantai is a farmer on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last two years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend 80,000 shillings on maize farming on his 10-acre farm. Maize has proved to be doing very well due to fertile soil in the area and adequate rainfall. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his maize production. He also hopes to buy some livestock and start livestock farming.

His future dream is that he will be able to practice large-scale maize farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Maize farming on his 10-acre farm

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: S. Zarifa has been selling foodstuffs and drinks in her grocery store for the past five years. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Zarifa is focused on expanding her business and is currently seeking a loan of 13,000 Somoni. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Zarifa hopes to expand her grocery store and improve the living standard of her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand her business

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan M. is a 54-year-old married man blessed with twelve children who are all above eighteen years of age.

Nathan is currently a water vendor operating from a kiosk. He has been in this business for the past six years now and this marks his third borrowing from KADET. He wishes to expand the business by building another water kiosk and later use the anticipated profits to renovate the old one. By doing this, Nathan hopes to increase the number of his customers who are mainly residents of Jomvu, Mombasa.

loans.use: To expand his business by building another water kiosk

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty O. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut phase (peanut paste) and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal to sell at home. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

Betty is 21 years old and is married to a security guard. She has two children and her children go to school.

loans.use: To stock bags of charcoal to sell at home

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy D. is a 34-year-old mother of two children and a wife to Mr. Naftal. Her family lives in Jomvu, Mombasa, the place where she also gets to conduct her business.

Nancy sells clothes as a way of earning her living and has been operating her business for two years now. She wishes to expand her business even further and use the anticipated profit to help educate her children. As a result of this, she has found it necessary to borrow money from KADET for the second time.

As Nancy tries to expand her business, she hopes that in future she will be able to own her own boutique and no longer have to hawk (sell door-to-door).

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. is currently in the business of selling fruits such as oranges, pineapples, lemons and guava at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more oranges to sell.

Josephine is 47 years old and is married to a soldier. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a pub.

loans.use: To stock more oranges to sell

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en:
S. Mirzoali is 42 years old. Together with his wife they have raised 5 children. Mirzoali is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 5 years. He bakes the traditional bread “lepeshka” at home. His children and wife help him with his business. Having many customers, Mirzoali is selling the majority of his products just from his home. However, he also has a shop in the central local market to sell the ”lepeshka”. Now, Mirzoali is requesting a loan $1000 USD. He is planning to purchase flour at wholesale which is the basic requirement of his business. Mirzoali is grateful to all those supporting him and promises to manage the loan carefully.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour at wholesale to bake the traditional bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah P. is 37 years old, and she sells second hand clothes and tailoring services in Shanzu Mombasa. Married to Burton Francis who helps support their family income, they have four children aged between six and fifteen years.

Deborah is borrowing her second loan from KADET which she hopes to use to purchase additional second hand clothes and a sewing machine for her busines. She hopes to use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Most of her clients are passersby and the area residents of Shanzu.
In future Deborah P. hopes to own a tailoring school.

loans.use: To purchase additional second hand clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Mwanachuo

texts.en:
Mwanachuo B. is a 35 years old lady, who has a road side café in Ganjoni estate.She is married to Abdalla Salim who is a transporter in Mombasa. The couple is blessed with three children. Mwanachuo has operated her kiosk for 10 years.

Mwanachuo was introduced to KADET by a KADET loan officer and this marks her first loan from KADET. With the money she plans to stock up on food stuff for the café and partly carry out some renovations in the premise. She eventually intends to use the anticipated profit to open up a hotel and hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: To stock up on food stuff for the café and carry out some renovations on the premises

loans.name: Vicki

texts.en: Vicki J. is currently in the business of selling bread, fried eggs and fried sweet potatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more sweet potatoes to sell.  Vicki is 28 years old and is married.  Her husband is a driver. She has 3 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah G. is a 30 years old posho mill owner in Miritini, Mombasa. Supporting one child, Lydiah is married to Henry Kimani, who has an income as a businessman. Lydiah has been in the business of grinding cereals and selling them to the area locals for the three years.

This marks Lydiah's first borrowing from KADET micro-finance in order to finance her business. She plans to purchase more stock of cereals for her posho mill and use the anticipated profits to add more cereals stock.

Lydiah hopes to expand her business and own more mills in future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cereals to grind in her posho mill

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en:
Wellington R. is 64 years old. He is a sole proprietor of a primary and secondary school in Jomvu. R. is a family man and is sometimes supported by his grown up children who are all working. R. has operated his school for one year and is happy with the progress he has achieved so far.  

This is R.'s third loan from KADET and he plans to use it to buy new furniture for the school and carry out the necessary renovations. With the anticipated profit from the business he would like to build extra classrooms to accommodate more students and succeed in life in future.

loans.use: plans to use it to buy new furniture for his school

loans.name: Aganess

texts.en: Aganess L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Aganess is 41 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 6 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike to transport charcoal to her home foe resale.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Edita

texts.en: Edita R.  is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in the restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to sell.  Edita is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and provide them with necessary scholastic materials.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs to sell in the restaurant

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence O. is 35 years old, she is a sole proprietor business lady who runs a nursery school in Jomvu, Mambasa. She is married to Nashon Nyakwoyo who is employed and they have one child aged six years.

Mary has been in this business for the past  two years and being a KADET member she intends use her second loan to purchase more desks and chairs for her school, and use the anticipated profit to expand the premise.

In the future Florence intends to have both Nursery, Primary  and Secondary school running together to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more desks and chairs for her school

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi K. is 33 years old. He is a fish monger and a firewood dealer in  Mtwapa. He is  married to Rajab Kikao who supports his income and they have three children. K. has been in this business for the last 10 years and his business is a success.

This marks his first borrowing from  KADET and he plans to add to his stock of fire wood and fish. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. K.’s main clients are the residents of Mtwapa, Mombasa.

In future he wishes to become a wholesale fish monger, dealing in many fish species.

loans.use: to add his stock of firewood and fish

loans.name: Ali Voya

texts.en:
Ali Voya is a 25-year-old resident of Likoni who supplies foodstuffs to shops and food kiosks to earn his living. Being married, he has three children.

Ali Voya has been in the business for one year and now he is taking a second loan from KADET to boost his stock of foodstuff for his supplies. Having his business located in places like Likoni, Mtongwe, Kona Mbaya, Bubu, around homesteads and by the roadside, he hopes to have more sales and succeed in life through his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of foodstuffs for his supplies

loans.name: Edward Saitoti

texts.en:
Edward Saitoti M. is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last two years. Edward is 29 years old and he supports three people in his family. His spouse is Namuutui M. who assists him with his farming activities.

Edward learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member. This will be Edward’s second loan of which he is planning to spend 25,000 shillings on plowing, 20,000 on harrowing, 20,000 on seeds and 15,000 on planting his ten-acre wheat farm.

Edward hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Edward’s dream is to do large-scale farming, to attain financial independence and to buy his own farm machinery. He is hardworking and determined to achieve his dream.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to pay for plowing, harrowing and planting

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda J. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables such as okra, sukuma wiki (kale), dodo (leafy greens of the amaranth plant) and fruits such as oranges, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.

Rhoda is 29 years old and is married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is single and owns a small business located in a small store in downtown Mukachevo which she started two years ago. She sells school and office supplies as well as decorations and souvenir items. She saw a high demand for these kinds of articles and decided to start a retail business.

Natalya plans to develop her business further and make it a stable financial foundation for her future. She would like to borrow 8,000 Grivnas to increase her assortment of school supplies. She hopes to increase her sales at the beginning of the school year and make additional income.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of school supplies

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine D. is currently in the business of selling fried fish, bread and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to fry and sell.

Katherine is 48 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice K. is a 44 years old mother with four children and a husband. She operates a food kiosk on a daily basis in Majaoni, Mombasa. Alice has been in this business for the past ten years and now wishes to expand her business and venture into fish mongering.  

This is the second time that she is borrowing from KADET and plans to buy stock of fish and a deep freezer. She hopes that the anticipated profits from the business will help her educate her children and also be able to own a well established fish shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fish and a deepfreezer

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina D. is currently in the business of selling fried fish, sweet potatoes and bread near a primary school  and is requesting a loan to stock groundnut paste and ice cream to sell.  Rina is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a police officer. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock groundnut paste and ice cream to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy M.  is currently in the business of selling dried green vegetables such as okra, water Mellon and fish at the marke. She is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell.  Joy is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her family.

loans.use: Stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Perss

texts.en: Perss B.  is currently in the business of selling bags of maize flour, rice and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish to sell.  Perss is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a store of goods.

loans.use: Stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: Seysekul

texts.en:
Seysekul K.  lives in Kamishanovka village in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is 57 years old and has two daughters, one of whom lives with her. Seysekul has been married to her husband, Japarbek, for 35 years. During these years, this couple went through some difficult times but always supported each other in all activities. Now, Seysekul and her husband are on a pension and have only 3,200 KGS monthly, which does not meet all expenses of the household at all.  

In order to support her family, Seysekul decided to start animal breeding. She bought several bull-calves, fattened them, and sold them at the local market.  But she could not enlarge her business because she needed to pay for expensive medical treatment for her husband. 

 Today, Seysekul has only one sheep at her farm. She plans to use the loan of 85,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing one milk cow and two bull-calves. With the revenue from this investment, Seysekul plans further development of her household. As for her dreams, Seysekul wants to go for a vacation some day and visit the mountain lake Issyk-Kul. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a milch cow and two bull-calves

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr:
SOKHNA DIENG est une femme de 29 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de AWLIDANE depuis le 19 novembre 2004.

Elle a 11 fois de suite reçu de crédits qui lui permettent de développer un commerce de draps de lit et de pots de fleure. 

Avec son prêt elle va acheter des draps de lit et des pots de fleure. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar pour revendre à Bambey son lieu de résidence. 

Son objectif est participer à la satisfaction des besoins familiaux. A partir de ses bénéfices elle verse mensuellement une épargne au niveau de son Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
SOKHNA DIENG is 29 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of the AWLIDANE Banc Villageois since November 19, 2004. She has received 11 consecutive loans which enabled her to develop a business selling bed sheets and flower pots. She is going to buy bed sheets and flower pots with her loan. She gets her supplies in Dakar to sell in Bambey, her place of residence. Her goal is to contribute to providing for her family's needs. She makes a monthly payment into her savings at the Banc Villageois from her earnings.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed sheets and flower pots

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose P. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer fro her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Rose is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar at the market premises.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has one son. She owns a small business that sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for fifteen years. She has always offered high quality products and excellent client service. She has many repeat clients that make her business a success. Irina has an active life that encourages her business neighbors and friends. 

Irina has used micro-loans before and found them very helpful. This time, she would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and receive additional income to take better care of her family as well as help her son pay for college.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of clothes for sale

loans.name: Magarete

texts.en: Margarete Y. is currently in the business of selling plastic cups, plates, bowls and water jerrycans. She is requesting a loan to stock more bowls and water jerrycans to sell.  Margarete is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 2 children and 1 child only  goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up her store of supplies.

loans.use: Stock more bowls and water jerrycans to sell

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr:
Daba T. est une femme de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis le 19 novembre 2004. Elle a 11 fois de suite reçu de crédit auprès de CAURIE-MICROFINANCE.

Elle fait de l"embouche ovine et bovine. Elle mène cette activité depuit plus de 5 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter 15 moutons à raison de 20.000 francs CFA l'unité et une paire de bœufs à 150.000 francs CFA. Elle va également acheter de l'aliment de bétail et du foin. Elle va engraisser les animaux pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. 

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Daba T. is 56 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the WALIDANE Banc Villageois since November 19, 2004. She has had 11 consecutive loans from CAURIE-MICROFINANCE. She has been raising sheep and cattle for more than 5 years. With her new loan, she is going to buy 15 sheep at the rate of 20,000 francs CFA each and a pair of cattle for 150,000 francs CFA. She is also going to buy livestock feed and hay. She is going to fatten the animals for 5 months before selling them in the weekly markets in her locality. Her goal is to contribute to the improvement of her family’s living conditions, while also increasing her savings.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and cattle

loans.name: Yatamu

texts.en:
Yatamu is married to a business woman and he is 27 years old. He has two children who are 2 and 4 years old. The children don’t go to school yet. He owns a small shop that sells foodstuffs and skewers of roasted meat. He also owns a bar. 

He intends to use this loan by invest in his business with the aim of increasing his profits. He will increase his inventory of foodstuffs to sell in his shop.  He plans to use the profits that he will make from this loan,  to renovating both his shop premises and his house.

loans.use: To buy suppplies of food stuffs.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is a married woman aged 28 years old with three children, two of whom are 6-year-old twins and the third is 5 months old.  The twins are in nursery school. She owns a small shop that specializes in selling food products such as cassava, potatoes, bananas, beans, etc.

Francoise intends to use this loan to increase the variety of food products she sells with the intention of increasing her income and capital in the near future. She also intends to use this loan to graduate from being a retailer to a wholesaler. She has a vision of venturing into another profit generating business if she gets adequate capital.

loans.use: Buying a greater variety of food stuffs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fannie

texts.en:
Fannie is married to a secondary school teacher and has 3 dependents.  She sells used clothing and food items in Makeni.  Fannie has 10 years of experience in business and was initially financed by her husband.

Fannie needs a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to purchase more used clothing and food items.  She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate her children to University level and support her husband who is finishing building a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Yanina

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven madre de familia, tiene 18 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y a su menor hijo en el centro poblado Santa Rosa del distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, una zona agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Chepén, en la región La Libertad,se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de bebidas en una bodega situada en su domicilio, ella ofrece todo tipo de bebidas a sus clientes y vecinos desde hace diez meses, este negocio cuenta con bastante acogida ya que el buen trato con el que brinda a sus clientes le han hecho conocida en la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad colabora con el sostenimiento de su familia. Su esposo se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima trabajando.

Sandra desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas bebidas, de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a la demanda de sus clientes, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven bastante tranquila y optimista, su anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para asegurarle a su familia la calidad de vida que ellos necesitan. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos le consideran una mujer responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Sandra, 18, is a young mother. She lives with her mother and young son in Santa Rosa, Pueblo Nuevo district, an agricultural area that is part of Chepén province, La Libertad region. It is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She has a store in her house where she sells all kinds of beverages to her customers and neighbors. She has been in business for 10 months. Her store is quite popular thanks to the good service she provides; she has become quite well known in the area. Earnings from this activity allow her to contribute to the family’s support. Her husband is currently working in Lima. Sandra wants to expand her business buying more beverages so that she can better meet customer demand. To reach this goal she has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for an 800 new sol loan. She is quite a levelheaded, optimistic young woman. Her dream is to continue to grow as a businesswoman to insure for her family the quality of life they need. In the area where she lives her neighbors consider her to be a responsible and hard working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu M., who is married to an active business woman, has three children, one in primary school and two in secondary school. He also has two other dependents who are his relatives.

An experienced trader, for the past 10 years Saidu has been selling ladies' shoes and bags at one of the most popular sections in the central market of Makeni City Bo. With a very good credit history, he is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 SLL, to increase his stock in order to earn more income to better take care of his home and educate his children to tertiary level. He thanks you for supporting him.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for his stall

loans.name: Geroncio Ecuador

texts.es:
Geroncio de 51 años, el es vendedor de utensilios de cocina, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Hace años atrás el era taxista pero en una tarde lo secuestraron con su taxi y dejo esta actividad debido a la inseguridad, comenzó a vender utensilios de cocina para poder mantener a su familia,  por ahora trabaja con dos personas mas que lo ayudan en las ventas, trabaja desde las 08h30 hasta las 13h00pm. Vende ollas, sartenes, platos etc. 

Con el préstamo el quiere comprar ollas, platos para su negocio, en el futuro el quiere tener un local para vender mejor su mercadería.
texts.en:
Geroncio is 51 years old and sells kitchenware for a living. He lives in El Guasmo in Guayaquil (a section of the city where the majority of the residents are informal merchants). Years ago he was a taxi driver, but one afternoon he was kidnapped along with his taxi so he quit this job because it wasn't safe. He started to sell kitchenware to support his family and now he works with two other people that help him with sales. He works from 8:30 in the morning until 1:00 in the afternoon. He sells pots,pans, dishes, etc. With this loan he wants to buy pots and dishes for his business. In the future he would like to have a store to better sell his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchenware to sell

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Augustine K., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Togetherness. He is 38 years old, single and has five children who range from 11 months to 18 years old. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial difficulty.

For five years, Augustine has been selling diesel fuel at Soul Clinic Market, Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 37,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of diesel fuel. Describing himself as a determined and hardworK. man, Augustine's goals are to improve his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of diesel fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items for his stall

loans.name: God’S Willing Group

texts.en:
Martin D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Willing. He is 38 years old and is married with two children 9 and 13 years old. He also cares for six siblings. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty. 

For ten years, Martin has been operating a foreign exchange bureau at Red Light Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

Martin plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to add more money to his business. He describes himself as an earnest and hardworking man. His dream is to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To add more money to his business

loans.name: Pedro Nilton

texts.es: El Sr. B. R. Pedro Nilton de 26 años de edad vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Pachacutec. Trabaja como Mecánico en la empresa Anthony Mottors. Su esposa es ama de casa. El Sr. Pedro es una persona muy emprendedora que grácias a su esfuerzo a logrado salir adelante construyendo parte de su vivienda. Su sueño segun nos comenta es terminar de construir su vivienda para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Es por eso que requiere el crédito para terminar de construir dicha vivienda. El Sr. Pedro esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro Nilton B. R., 26, lives with his wife and young son in his own home located in Pachacutec district. He is employed at Anthony Motors as a mechanic. His wife is a housewife. Pedro is a very enterprising person who has managed to partially build his home thanks to his efforts. He tells us that his greatest wish is to finish building it in order to provide his family with a better quality of life. For this reason he is asking for funding to complete his house. Pedro is very grateful for whatever support we might be able to offer through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more plantains and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 19 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos. Desde hace más de 2 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, en su misma casa tiene su granja de las cuales todos los días  cuida con mucho empeño para  garantizar de que sus animales estén bien alimentados ya que de eso depende sus ventas en las ferias ganaderas de su comunidad. Para mantener bien alimentados a sus animales, procura siempre darles alfalfa, planta que cultiva y extrae cada cierto tiempo. Considera que su trabajo es rentable porque los cuyes son animales muy cotizados por su zona, por tener alto grado nutritivo, por lo que recibe buenas rentas por sus ventas. Ante esto, decide ampliar sus galpones para abarcar mayor cantidad de animales. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de maderas y rejillas para construir más galpones.
texts.en:
Edgar, 19, lives with his parents. For over two years he has raised small farm animals. He has his farm at his house and every day he cares for his animals with lots of effort hoping to make sure they are well fed because this is what sales at the area livestock markets depend upon. To keep his animals well fed he tries to always give them alfalfa, a plant that he grows and cuts often. He considers his work to be profitable because guinea pigs are quite in demand in his area because they are of high nutritional value; his profits, therefore, are good. Because of this he wants to enlarge his sheds in order to house larger numbers of animals. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he can count on financial support. Besides, he enjoys being part of a communal group because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive. He is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan he is requesting which will be very useful for his business’ progress. He will use the requested funds to buy lumber and grilles to build more sheds.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber and grilles to build sheds for guinea pigs.

loans.name: Benkadi 1(Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de Warasso dans l’ex l’arrondissement de Kimparana du cercle de SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du maïs. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
KOROTOUMOU S., la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture. Elle s’approvisionne  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30 000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women from the village of Warasso in the former quarter of Kimparana in the SAN circle, in the Ségou region (the fourth largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. They are all around 35 years old and have 5 children on average. They grow peanuts and corn for a living. With the aim of boosting profits from their agricultural activities the group's members have decided to seek a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. KOROTOUMOU S., the group's president, aims to use the loan to purchase a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small tools and other inputs for cultivating these crops. They source their goods from Kimparana. Following wintering of the crops the harvest is stocked for a given length of time so that it may accrue value before being sold at the same market and in the neighbouring markets for retail and bulk sales. Sales are usually cash-based and the customers usually come from large towns. The group's members aim to each generate between 30 000 and 45 000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and to meet their families' expenses.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Luisa Maria

texts.es:
Luisa de 52 años, ella elabora productos para limpieza, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Ella comenzó con la producción de cloro y detergente para poder ayuda con los gastos familiares, su esposo trabaja con ella, los productos que venden tienen como marca “súper limpiecito”, trabajan desde muy temprano hasta las 17h00pm. Venden por galón y por litros. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo químicos para hacer cloros y detergente, en el futuro quiere arreglar y readecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa, 52 years old, makes cleaning products. She lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban zone where most of the people work as street vendors. She started manufacturing chlorine and detergent to help with the family's expenses. Her husband works with her and their products bear the "Super Limpiecito" ("squeaky clean") brand. They work from very early in the morning until 5pm and sell by the gallon and by the liter. She wants to purchase chemicals to manufacture the chlorine and detergent with the loan. In the future, she wants to fix and improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chlorine, desinfectant

loans.name: Benkadi 2 (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 2  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de WARASSO dans l’ex l’arrondissement de Kimparana, du cercle de SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, avec en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 7 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du maïs. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. 
KADIA S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants,  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 2 (entente, or "unity") group consists of married women from the village of Warasso in the in the ex neighborhood of Kimparana in the district of San in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) They live in traditional families, are on the average 35 years of age and have seven children. They grow peanuts and corn. In order to ensure that their agricultural activities are profitable, earlier this year they have decided to take advantage of the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. Kadia S. plans to use her part of the loan to purchase ample supply of peanut seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs at the big market of Kimparana. After the winter season, the harvest is stocked for a while until it goes up in price before being resold at the big market of Kimparana and at the nearby market, retail (often wholesale too), for cash to a customer base mainly coming from large towns. After this agricultural season, the group members plan to obtain a revenue ranging from 25,000 to 35,000 West African francs each, to be used for repaying the loan interests as well as for the everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Able God Group

texts.en:
Kuluba C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Able God. Kuluba is 60 years old, married, and has two children who range from 26 to 28 years old. She cares for one sibling. She holds an Associate of Arts degree in business administration. 

For more than twelve years, she has been selling used clothes at Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000 LRD portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. She describes herself as a hard working woman.

Her goal is to improve her business and build a store.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Edilmira

texts.es: Edilmira tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 11 años trabaja en los campos agrícolas, que junto con su esposo cultivan papa y maíz sobre extensiones de terrenos que poseen. Su trabajo es arduo y todos los días se dedica a cuidar sus tierras, y cuando es época de cosecha es donde necesita de manos para realizar  este trabajo, pero sabe además que gracias a ello, puede percibir ganancias regulares. Afirma que le gusta su trabajo porque le permite tener disponible los alimentos necesario para su familia y disfrutar de la vida de campo. Ante esto, desea ampliar su siembra para la próxima temporada. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas de papa de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Edilmira, 30, lives with her husband and three children in her own house. She has been a farmer for the last 11 years. Together with her husband she farms potato and corn on fields they own. Her work is arduous and every day she cares for her crops. During harvest time she needs to hire laborers to help with the work but she knows that it’s thanks to this that she can earn regular profits. She states that she enjoys her work because it provides her family with needed food and she can enjoy life in the countryside. Because of this she’d like to expand her plantings next season. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial help. Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal group because all of its members are responsible and mutually supportive people. She is grateful to all those people who will fund the loan she is requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the funds to buy sacks of manure and better quality potato seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and potato seed.

loans.name: Amado Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Amado es casado, tiene cuatros (4) hijos todos en edad escolar básica, está domiciliado en la ciudad de Caacupé, Barrio Santa Ana, camino a Tobati. 
El Sr. Amado desde muy joven trabajaba en una chipería de la zona donde adquirió experiencia, es así que cuando se casó monto su propia chipería donde hoy elabora su deliciosa chipa y lo lleva a ofertar en la ciudad de Aregua, desde entonces fue ganando clientela hasta hoy día.
Solicita el apoyo de la fundación y kiva con un crédito, para invertir en la compra de materia prima (almidón, queso, grasa vegetal, entre otros), para la fabricación de su producto, teniendo en cantidades estos lo facilita la producción, podrá satisfacer la demanda de su clientela y obtener más ingresos a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Amado is married and has four children, all in elementary school. He lives in the Santa Ana district in the town of Caacupé on the way to Tobati. Amado had been working in a local "chiperia" (shop that sells chipa - a warm, bagel-like bread with cheese in its center) since he was very young. He gained experience and when he got married he started his own business where today he makes his delicious "chipa". He sells his product in the town of Aregua where he built his clientele. He requests the foundation and Kiva's support in granting him a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials (starch, cheese, vegetable oil, among others) to make his product. Having a certain quantity of raw materials helps with production, will help him meet his client's demand and obtain more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of starch and cheese

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, fish, meat, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Sonnie United Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Sonnie United. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children who range from 6 to 11 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty. She cares for one sibling.

For seven years, she has been selling red oil in Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more gallons of red oil. She describes herself as a principle-minded woman.

Her goal is to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha de 45 años, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Desde hace 2 años atrás, comenzó a comprar víveres para venderlos a sus vecinos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprar suficiente mercadería para ubicar una pequeña tienda, ahora ella trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días con ayuda de sus hijos. 

Para poder seguir con su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, confites. En el futuro quiere tener un Minimarket que cumpla con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old. She has a small store in the front of her house. She lives in El Guasmo in Guayaquil (a section of the city where the majority of the residents are informal merchants). Two years ago she started buying groceries to sell to her neighbors and little by little, with effort and dedication, she was able to buy enough merchandise to start a small store. Now, with the help of her children, she works every day from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. In order to be able to maintain her store she will use the loan to buy rice, drinks and candy. In the future, she would like to have a mini-market so that she can satisfy all her customer's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, drinks and candy for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more eggs and more bags of flour and sugar

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia. Lleva más de 30 años de experiencia en la agricultura y ganadería y su esposa es su principal apoyo en esta tarea. Cuando se requiere de mayor  esfuerzo  contrata  peones y algunas ocasiones sus hijos lo ayudan en la cosecha, ya que tiene considerables áreas de terreno cultivable. Por otro lado, cuando espera el tiempo de cosecha, se dedica a vender animales, de esta manera percibe un ingreso adicional a su economía. Siempre le ha gustado trabajar en el campo, es por eso que desea continuar en esta actividad y mejorar en su producción. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 53, lives with his wife in his own house. He has been a farmer and cattleman for over 30 years and his wife is his main helper in these chores. When a greater effort is needed, however, he hires laborers and sometimes his sons help with the harvest because he has extensive fields under cultivation. While he is waiting for harvest time to come he raises animals for sale to augment his income. He has always enjoyed working in the countryside and wants to continue and improve this activity. This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support. Besides, he likes being part of a communal bank because all its members are responsible and mutually supportive. He is grateful to all the people who will fund the requested loan which will be very useful for his business’ success. He will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Ellen G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Hope To God. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children who range from 16 to 23 years old. She cares for two children.

She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. 

For three years, she has been selling fish at Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of fish to sell. She describes herself as a jovial woman.

Her dream is to grow her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es: La  Sra. María Auxiliadora G. N.   ella es Trabajadora del Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como Asistente de Eventos tiene  un año de trabajar para esta empresa. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora G. N. works at the Hotel Barceló Montelimar as Events Assistant. She has been working for this business for a year. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL and has used them to purchase construction materials to improve the house where she lives. The loans have benefited her greatly since as a result she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone and gravel

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil

loans.name: Angelica Julieta

texts.es:
Angélica de 54 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene un taller de zapatería. 

Hace 30 años, ella comenzó a trabajar en el negocio de una amiga haciendo zapatillas pero como los ingresos no eran tan buenos para mantener a sus tres hijos, decidió independizarse y tener su propio negocio, ahora ella tiene su taller de zapatería trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 16h00pm y tiene un ayudante. 

Para variar los diseños de zapatos ella necesita comprar con el préstamo materiales como suelas, cuero, pegamento. En el futuro quiere tener una empresa de distribución en la línea de zapatos con su propia maca.
texts.en:
Angélica, 54, lives in El Guasmo, Guayaquil (an urban zone most of whose residents are informal merchants). She has a shoe shop. Thirty years ago she started working in a friend’s shop making slippers but, because her income was insufficient to support her three children, she decided to strike out on her own and open her own business. Now she has her shoe shop where she works from 8am until 4pm and she employs an assistant. To vary the designs of the shoes she needs the loan to buy supplies like soles, leather and glue. In the future she’d like to have a firm to distribute her own brand of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For glue and soles.

loans.name: Fanta’S Group

texts.en:
Fanta Jarbate, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Fanta’s Group. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children who range from 11 to 26 years old. She cares for one sibling. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. 

For four years, she has been selling beans, peanuts and pepper at Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of beans, peanuts and pepper. She describes herself as a determined woman.

Her dream is to grow her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans, peanuts and pepper to sell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Lila y lo que mas le agrada son los prestamos fáciles y las capacitaciones.
Aurelia es casada y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 6 estudian, Aurelia sueña con que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
Aurelia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región dos veces por semana, en donde vende ropa variada, los demás días se encarga de sus hijos. Solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de faldas y chompas.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the communal bank Lila. She is very grateful for the easy loans and the training classes. Aurelia is married and has 7 children, 6 of whom are in school. She dreams that her children will be able to finish school and become professionals. Aurelia travels to the different fairs in the region two times a week where she sells various types of clothing. The other days she cares for her children. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to buy skirts and sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase skirts and sweaters

loans.name: Yovany

texts.es:
Yovany pertenece al Banco Comunal Lila y lo que mas le gusta son el incentivo al ahorro ya que en casa no puede hacerlo además de la facilidad del préstamo.
Yovany es conviviente y luego de muchos años de convivencia se casara este año, tiene 2 hijas que están estudiando y su mayor sueño es que ellas tengan todas las comodidades y que sean profesionales. Yovany es profesora de profesión y trabaja por las mañanas, además se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos en un hornos alquilado, actividad que aprendió de su madre, también atiende pedidos de sus clientes.
Yovany solicita un crédito de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de canela, coco, esencia de vainilla que comprará al por mayor de la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
Yovany is a member of the Lila (Lilac) communal bank. What she likes best are the savings incentives because at home she can’t do it; she also likes the easy loan terms. Yovany has lived with her partner for a long time and after all these years plans to marry him this year. She has two daughters that are in school and her greatest wish is that they have all the comforts and that they become professionals. Yovany works as a teacher during the mornings but she also bakes typical regional bread using a leased oven. She learned this skill from her mother. She also tends to customers’ orders. Yovany is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy cinnamon, coconut and vanilla extract in quantity in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cinnamon, coconut and vanilla extract.

loans.name: Cesarea

texts.es:
Cesarea es casada y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 6 estudian, Cesarea tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Cesarea es socia del Banco Comunal Lila y durante este tiempo los prestamos le ayudaron en su negocio y con ello pudo educar a sus hijos, Cesarea solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Cesarea sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Cesarea is married and has 8 children, six of whom are still in school. She has a grocery store in her home where she stocks assorted groceries, vegetables and meat. She is open for business every day and sometimes gets help from her children. Cesarea is a member of the “Lila” (Lilac) communal bank and the loans have helped her business and that made it possible for her to educate her children. Cesarea is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. Her dream is that her children become professionals and to be able to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana nació en la ciudad de Chinchero que está ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Roxana vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y su hijo (Mario Cesar de un año). Roxana tiene  23 años y hace 15 años atrás se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas a los turistas extranjeros y nacionales que vienen a visitar la zona arqueológica de Chinchero.  Actualmente, Roxana pertenece  a la  Asociación Natividad de Chinchero (Es un grupo de vendedoras que se asociaron para tener beneficios sociales). A Roxana la pueden  encontrar en su puesto de venta, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde o hasta que los turistas se vayan del lugar.    

Con su próximo préstamo, Roxana que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Una parte del dinero del préstamo le gustaría comprar mercadería y la otra parte utilizara para el bautizo de su hijo.     

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, pero Roxana recién está participando  en el banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chichero”.
texts.en:
Roxana, 23, was born in the city of Chinchero located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. She currently lives in Cusco with her husband and son, Mario Cesar, 1. Roxana has sold sweets and soft drinks for the last 15 years to foreign and national tourists that come to visit the Chinchero archaeological sites. Roxana is a member of the Natividad de Chinchero Association (a group of vendors that united to get social benefits). One can find Roxana at her sales stand seven days a week from 7am until 6pm or until the tourists leave the site. Roxana expects to get 1000 new soles in her next loan. Part of the funds will be used to buy merchandise and the other will be used for her son’s Baptism. The “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” communal bank has been in operation for two and a half years but Roxana is a recent collaborator in the bank and does well. The name of the communal bank is a Quechua (the local native language) term that means “Beautiful Chinchero Princess.”

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and for her son's Baptism.

loans.name: Rafael Genaro

texts.es: El  Sr. Rafael Genaro C. M.   él es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Operario de Limpieza tiene  diez  año de trabajar para esta empresa. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael Genaro C. M. Works for the city of San Rafael Sur. He has been a municipal sanitation worker for 10 years. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL that he’s used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. The loans have been of great use to him in that his and his family’s living conditions improved.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, stone, gravel.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Lila y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad de los prestamos.
Maria es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos que estudian y ella sola es quien se encarga de la mantención de sus hijos, Maria viaja a la selva ayacuchana y ferias en donde verduras surtidas y de allá compra leña que vende en la puerta de su casa.
Maria solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña de los productores.
Maria sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante, tener casa propia porque vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Lila” (Lilac) communal bank. What she likes best are the easy loan terms. María is a single mother of five children who are students. She alone is responsible for their support. María travels into the Ayacucho backcountry and to farmers markets where she sells assorted vegetables. She brings back firewood that she then resells at her doorstep. María is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy firewood from the producers. María dreams with having her own house because she currently lives in her parents’ house. She also hopes that her children succeed. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood from producers.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre deposita mucho esfuerzo sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar los diferentes productos que ofrece como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y un poco de frutas. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio, pues tiene muchos clientes nuevos a quienes no quiero perderlos. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel, 49, sells basic grains. He has been in this business for over 8 years. He always puts in quite an effort and his customers come by regularly to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil and a bit of fruit. The financing he is requesting will be used to buy stock items for his store because he has many new customers and he doesn’t want to lose them. His wish is to improve the condition of his home and expand his store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens, meat, rice and beans.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo que estudia en la universidad, Paulina es Bióloga de profesional y trabaja para instituciones pero su meta es tener un laboratorio propio. Paulina vende cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son en mayor parte al crédito.
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Lila y solicita un préstamo de 1000 para la compra de aretes, cremas y labiales.
texts.en:
Paulina lives with her life partner and has a son who is in the university. She is a Biologist and works for several institutions but her goal is to own her own laboratory. Paulina sells catalogue cosmetics to friends and family for the most part on credit. She is a member of the “Lila” (Lilac) communal bank and is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy earrings, creams and lipsticks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy earrings, creams and lipsticks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, beans and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es casada y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 2 estudian, Luisa tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. comida, actividad que inicia a las 5 D. la mañana hasta las 10 D. la mañana, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Lila y solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite por sacos.
Los sueños D. Luisa es mejorar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa is married and has 6 children two of whom are in school. She has a stand in the Magdalena Market where she sells food starting at 5am and going until 10am; her children help out. Luisa is a member of the “Lila” (Lilac) communal bank and is asking for a 100 sol loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar and to buy cooking oil. Luisa’s dream is to make improvements to her home and to expand her store.
