El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Ambrocio pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Ambrocio lives with his wife in the community of Cajamarca in Cachimayo within the Anta province of Cusco, Peru. Cachimayo is located 25 minutes from the city of Cusco. Ambrocio works in livestock and agriculture. He has worked in this business for 20 years and does very well. In the mornings and evenings Ambrocio must graze and milk the animals. Ambrocio and his wife have several farms where they grow corn and potatoes. They sell their products at fairs and markets in the city of Cusco. With his next loan, Ambrocio hopes to receive USD 200. He would like to use the money to buy seeds and fertilizer. The community bank “Señor de Qoylluriti Cachimayo” has been in operation for three and a half years. Ambrocio has belonged to the bank for three years and has been doing well. The members are the bank are devotees of Taytacha Qoylluriti (Lord of Shining Show) so they named the bank as such.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds & fertilizer

loans.name: Zenobio

texts.es:
Zenobio nació en la ciudad de Paruro y tiene 23 años. Actualmente, Zenobio vive en la comunidad de Cajamarca del distrito de Cachimayo provincia de Anta departamento del Cusco junto con su esposa y su hija (Britt Alexandra de un año). La ciudad de Cachinayo se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Zenobio se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Hace dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Le pueden encontrar en su chacra, desde las 5 de la mañanas hasta 5 de la tarde, haciendo sus labores como pastear a las 20 vacas lecheras y otras labores que tiene.   

Con su próximo préstamo, Zenobio que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para compra un ganado. El sueño de la socia es comprarse un terreno donde puede cultivar papa, maíz, trigo y muchas cosas más.  

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Zenobio pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Zenobio, 23, was born in the city of Paruro. Currently, Zenobio lives in the community of Cajamarca, Cachimayo district, Anta province, Cusco department with his wife and daughter, Britt Alexandra, 1. Cachinayo is located 25 minutes from the city of Cusco. Zenobio has been a farmer and cattleman for the last two years and does well. One can find him tending to his fields from 5am until 5pm performing his pasturage chores with his 20 dairy cows and other chores he has. Zenobio expects to get 1000 new soles in his next loan that he’d like to use to buy a head of cattle. His dream is to buy a field where he can farm potatoes, corn, wheat and many other things. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) communal bank has been in operation for three and a half years and Zenobio has been a member for three years and does well. The members of this communal bank are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and this is the reason they named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina nació en la ciudad D. Cachimayo y tiene 52 años. Actualmente, Luz Marina vive en la  misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus 6 hijos. La ciudad D. Cachinayo se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.   

Bernardina se dedica a la venta D. leche D. forma ambulatoria en la ciudad del Cusco, ella recorre las calles D. la ciudad del cusco ofreciendo leche, tres veces a la semana desD. las 3 D. la tarD. hasta las 5 D. la noche. Los días domingos lleva a vender comida a la plaza principal D. Cachimayo. La pueden encontrar en su puesto D. venta, desD. las 9 D. la mañanas hasta 3 D. la tarD. o hasta se termine la comida. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Bernardina que espera recibir S/. 700 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar leche y insumos como por ejemplo arroz, carne, papa, cebollas, tomates, etc.

El banco comunal “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio D. funcionamiento, Bernardina pertenece desD. hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios D. este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor D. la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Bernardina was born in the city of Cachimayo and is 52 years old. Luz Marina lives in the same city, along with her husband and six children. Cachimayo is located 25 minutes from Cusco. Bernardina sells milk on foot in Cusco, buy walking through the city streets three times a week from 3:00 PM to 5:00 PM. On Sundays she sells food in the main Cachimayo plaza. One can find her at her stall from 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM, or until her food runs out. Bernardina is hoping for a loan of 700 PEN ($250). She wants to use the money to buy milk and ingredients, such as rice, meat, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, etc. The “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” communal bank has been operating for three years. Bernardina has been a member for three years and things are going well for her. Its members are devotees of the “Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor D. la Nieve Brillante)” church, so they chose this name for their communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milk and ingredients

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

El  socio es el Sr. Cesar; el socio tiene 29 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio se dedica al transporte él presta servicio de transporte en su moto convertida a taxi, las llamadas moto taxis, él socio, trabaja todo el día parando solo para ingerir sus alimentos, El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar y pagar una letra del banco.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. He lives in the Urubama province within the Cusco department. He is Cesar, 29 years old, married and lives with his life partner and two children. He provides transportation services via his motorcycle which he has converted into a taxi (moto taxi). He works all day, stopping only to eat. [Cesar] is asking for this loan in order to pay off a bank loan. He values and is grateful for this loan and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loan consolidation

loans.name: Filber

texts.es:
Filber nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 25 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su pareja y su hija Melodi de 4 años.
A los 21 años,  Filber aprendió  a reparte teléfonos móviles en la ciudad de Lima y después regreso al Cusco donde está ejerciendo su aprendizaje. 
 
Filber tiene una tienda en el centro comercial “El Paraíso”, donde hace mantenimiento y vende teléfonos móviles. Le pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Filber que espera recibir S/. 2000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar más mercadería como teléfonos móviles. El sueño del socio es abrir una tienda de venta de computadoras personales y venta de ropa y zapatillas de marca. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Filber pertenece desde hace varios años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Filber, 25, lives in Cusco with his partner and their daughter, Melodi, 4. At the age of 21, Filber learned how to distribute mobile phones in Lima and then returned to Cusco where he is applying his knowledge. Filber has a store in the “El Paraíso” shopping center where he sells and repairs mobile phones. He can be found tending his store seven days a week from 9am until 9pm. Filber expects to get 2000 new soles in his next loan that he’d like to use to buy more merchandise like mobile phones. His dream is to open a personal computer, clothing and brand name slippers store. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) communal bank has been in operation for three and a half years; Filber has been a member for several years and does well. The members of this communal bank are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and this is why they named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like mobile phones.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 58 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. 

Francisca se dedica a la venta de locería en las ciudades de Urubamba y Curahuasi de forma ambulatoria, los días domingos y miércoles respectivamente. Ella también tiene una pequeña tienda en Izcuchaca donde atiende todos los días. Francisca hace pedido de mercadería a sus proveedores de la ciudad de Lima. Ya son 32 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Francisca que espera recibir S/. 2000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar más mercadería como platos, tazas y muchas cosas más. El sueño de la socia es abrir una tienda de locería en la ciudad del Cusco.  

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Francisca pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Francisca is 58 years old. She lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and their four children. Francisca sells kitchenware on Sundays in Urubamba and on Wednesdays in Curahuasi. She sells in an itinerant manner. She also has a small store in Izcuchaca, which she takes care of everyday. Francisca orders her merchandise from providers in the city of Lima. She has been in this business for 32 years. It is going very well for her thanks to the determination she puts into her work. With her next loan Francisca hopes to receive 2,000 soles. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy more merchandise like plates, cups, and many other things. Her dream is to open a kitchenware store in the city of Cusco. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” Communal Bank has been operating for three and a half years. Francisca has belonged to the communal bank for three years. It is going very well for her. The members are devotees of Taytacho Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Brilliant Snow), and for this reason they gave the bank that name.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise like plates, cups, and many other things

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “PICAFLOR” se organiza para su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN, tiene una mesa directiva  que dirige a la asociación, está compuesta por Presidenta, Tesorera y Secretaria de Actas. La presidenta, doña Arminda se dedica a la cerrajería.   

En el caso de la Secretaria de Actas, la señora Elizabeth, se dedica a negociar con mercadería en general, productos de temporada.  Su primer crédito fue de Bs.500 .- y actualmente ha solicitado un crédito de Bs. 2000.-, ella recibe la ayuda de su esposo para llevar adelante este negocio.

Las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son siete mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: costurera, venta de carne, venta de carne de oveja, cerrajería, venta de fruta, venta de salchipapa, venta de víveres y venta de comida
texts.en:
The “PICAFLOR” (Hummingbird) communal bank is organizing its second cycle in the VILLA EXALTACIÓN Focal Center. It has a governing board that leads the association that is composed of a President, Treasurer and Recording Secretary. The president is Arminda who is a locksmith. The Recording Secretary is Elizabeth. She is a general merchant who sells seasonal items. Her first loan was for Bs.500 and she is currently requesting Bs.2000. Her husband helps her with the business. The members of the communal bank are seven women and one man. They have a variety of businesses like: seamstress services, meat sales, lamb meat sales, locksmith services, fruit sales, salchipapas (fried potatoes and fried sausages) sales, grocery and prepared food sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For merchandise.

loans.name: Sulu

texts.en:
Sulu T. is 57 and married with 7 children.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Sulu has 2 years of experience in this business.  Sulu needs a loan of WST$2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Sulu joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Sulu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

El  socio es el Sr. Rolando; el socio tiene 38 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio es natural de Puno,  El socio se  dedica a administrar su bodega, el tiene junto a su conyugue una bodeguita, es una especie de tienda abarrotes pero más surtida. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar e implementar su negocio.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rolando, 38, is a member of the “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” communal bank; he lives in Urubamba, Cusco department. He lives with his significant other and their two children. He is originally from Puno. He and his spouse have a small store which he runs. It is sort of a grocery store but more widely stocked. He is asking for funds to increase the stock in his store. He values and appreciates the loan granted and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: San Juan  Masias Group

texts.es:
Cuando el esposo de la Sra. María perdió el trabajo ella vio la necesidad de trabajar entes no lo hacia por dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos, es así que fue en busca de trabajo al no encontrarlo vio la manera de generar sus propios ingresos fue al mercado donde tenia una amiga quien  le dio la idea de vender menestras cosidas ya que no había  ese tipo de producto en dicho mercado no lo pensó mucho y alquilo un puesto de venta  con lo poco que tenia empezó la venta de  menestras como  fréjoles, lentejas, trigos etc. 
  empezó vendiendo   solo algunos kilos  ahora su negocio ha crecido mucho, en la actualidad  ofrece mas variedad y  cantidad  tiene que sancochar muchas menestras también   incursiono en la venta de verduras picadas  algo que sus caseras le pedían gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido lograr muchas cosas una de ellas es construir su casita donde tiene varios departamentos que alquilara  para que eso le genere otros ingresos su préstamo lo usara para terminar algunas partes de la construcción , también quiere comprarse una moto taxi para transportar su negocio ya que gasta mucha movilidad llevando sus insumos al mercado donde trabaja ,  para el futuro esta buscando otro mercado donde pueda poner su negocio de manera que pueda crecer, la Sra. María  acaba de ser nombrada la nueva presidenta del grupo “SAN JUAN MASIAS “ conformada por 07 socias trabajadoras como ella.

* La Sra Maria esta al final de la fila, la ultima de la derecha esta con ropa negra.
texts.en:
When María’s husband lost his job she was faced with the need to work; she hadn’t worked previously because she was caring for her children. She went out to look for work but couldn’t find any employment. Seeing that she couldn’t find a way to generate her own income she visited a friend in the market who gave her the idea of selling prepared meals since this market didn’t have anyone doing this kind of work. She didn’t have to think about it very long. She rented a stall with the little funds she had and started to sell food like: beans, lentils, wheat, etc. She started out selling just a few kilos but now her business has grown quite a bit. She currently offers more variety and quantity. She also has to fry up more meals and she went into the diced vegetable sales business, something housewives were requesting. Thanks to her efforts and work she has managed to reach many goals. One of them was to build her house where she also has several rental units that she will lease to earn extra income. She will use the loan to finish part of the construction. She also wants to buy herself a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) because she spends a lot of time moving her ingredients to the market where she works. For the future she’s looking for an additional market where she can install her business so that she can grow. María has just been named the new President of the “SAN JUAN MASIAS” communal bank which is composed of 7 hard working members like her. * María is at the end of the row, the last one on the right, dressed in black.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her rental units.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 44 años y vive en el distrito de Cachimayo provincia de Anta departamento del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus  5 hijos. La ciudad de Cachinayo se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Eugenia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, cuyes y gallinas, ella compra animales críos de la feria de Inquilpata y después de hacer engordar los animales, ella los vende en las ferias y mercados de Izcuchaca y Cusco. Ya son 3 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Eugenia que espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar ovejas. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Eugenia pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 44, lives in Cachimayo district, Anta province, Cusco department, with her husband and 5 children. The city of Cachimayo is located 25 minutes from the city of Cusco. Eugenia raises small farm animals like sheep, guinea pigs and chickens. She buys the young animals at Inquilpata’s farmers market and then fattens them up. She subsequently sells them at farmers markets and markets in Izcuchaca and Cusco. She has been in this business for 3 years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it. Eugenia expects to get 800 new soles in her next loan which she’d like to use to buy sheep. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) communal bank has been in operation for three and a half years; Eugenia has been a member for three years and does well. The members of this communal bank are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and this is the reason they named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Catalina Maruja

texts.es:
Catalina nació en el distrito de Pucyura y tiene 58 años. Actualmente, Catalina vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. La ciudad de Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Catalina se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños, ella tiene un puesto de venta en el centro comercial el Molino de la ciudad del Cusco, donde la pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Catalina nos cuenta que hace 6 años vendía de forma ambulatoria en la avenida ejército de la ciudad del Cusco pero ahora tiene un stand en el centro comercial.  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, cuyes y gallinas, ella compra animales críos de la feria de Inquilpata y después de hacer engordar los animales, ella los vende en las ferias y mercados de Izcuchaca y Cusco. Ya son 3 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Eugenia que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar ovejas. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Eugenia pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Catalina, 58, was born in Pucyura district. Currently, Catalina lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and 5 children. Pucyura is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Catalina sells children’s clothing. She has a sales stand in the El Molino shopping center in Cusco. She can be found there seven days a week from 9am until 8pm. Catalina tells us that six years ago she was an itinerant merchant along Ejército Avenue in Cusco but now she has a stand in the shopping center. She also raises small farm animals like sheep, guinea pigs and chickens that she buys newborn at Inquilpata farmers market to fatten up and later sell at markets in Izcuchaca and Cusco. She has been in this business for three years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it. Eugenia expects to get 1000 new soles in her next loan that she’d like to use to buy sheep. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) has been in operation for three and a half years; Eugenia has been a member for three years and does well. The members of this communal bank are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and this is why they named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Visión De Fe Group

texts.es: La señora Haydee N. L. es socia del banco Mujeres Chiumaltenango tiene 3 años de trabajar con fape la señora es muy trabajadora tiene 40 Años de edad tiene 4 hijos y su esposo la apoya mucho en su negocio ella tiene venta de tortillas y de chiles reyenos desde que inicio su credito en fape tiene una persona quien la ayuda para poder sacar sus pedido. La señora Elicia tiene 38 Años ella tiene su negocio ambulante y tiene 30 gallinas ponedoras. La Socia Eulalia tiene 30 Años ella se dedica a la elavoracion de ropa de bebe y a vender en diferente lugares tiene maquinas para poder elavorar los trajes anterior mente solo vendia en el mercado de Chimaltenango y Ahora ya se ha extendido en el departamento
texts.en:
Mrs. Haydee N. L. is a member of the Mujeres Chimaltenago bank and has worked with FAPE for the past 3 years. She is a hardworking 40 year old, has 4 children, and her husband is a big support for her in her business. She sells tortillas and stuffed chile peppers. Since she started working with FAPE she has had someone who helps her get her orders out. Mrs. Wlicia is 38, and she is a street vendor and has 30 laying hens. Member Eulalia is 30 and she works making baby clothing and sells them in different locations. She has sewing machines now to help her make the clothing. Before she only sold in the Chimaltenango market and now she is working throughout the Department.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de maiz para la tortillería, gallinas, y materias primas para la ropa

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Segundina; ella tiene 43 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos la socia tiene un pequeño restaurante en la avenida principal, ella trabaja atendiendo su propio restaurante y este le permite tener el control de sus hijos y ayudarlos con las tareas y demás, La socia ahorra sus ingresos y el de su esposo que es obrero para comprar su casa propia. La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su restaurante.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba" and lives in Urubamba province, Cusco department. The member is la Señora Segundina; she is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She also has a small restaurant on the main street. Working in her own restaurant allows her to control her children and to help them with homework and other matters. The member saves her income and the income of her husband, who is a laborer, with the goal of purchasing her own home. She requests this loan to improve her restaurant. She values and is grateful for this loan and thus is committed to making timely repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her restaurant

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 53 años, vive con su pareja Osvaldo de 54 años y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años que tiene un bazar y librería a la vez, ubicada en su propia casa, negocio que la da grandes gratificaciones, pues es su principal ingreso económico para ella y su familia. Desde entonces trata de abastecerse, adquiriendo productos al por mayor siendo útiles de escritorio, adornos y artículos para el hogar. Hay momentos que no cuenta con el producto que busca el cliente, por lo que pierde el cliente, es por ello que desea surtir mejor su tienda con el préstamo.  Alicia Tiene pensado en el futuro mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, techarlo y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos comestibles y útiles, para que los clientes puedan obtener todo lo que necesitan. Es la décima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas porque es muy responsable y además porque no quiere quedar mal con su grupo de trabajo que le han dado mucha confianza. Con el crédito que solicita, tiene pensado comprar mayor cantidad de útiles escolares por campaña ya que empiezan las clases y necesitará abastecerse de esta mercadería.
texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and lives with her fifty-four-year-old partner, Osvaldo, and their two children in their own home. For four years she has run a general store and book store from her home. This business gives her a great deal of satisfaction since it is the main source of income for her family. Since the beginning, she tried to see that the store was well-stocked. She acquires at wholesale stationery supplies and adornments and articles for the home. Sometimes she doesn't have the product a customer wants, and she loses the customer; therefore, she wishes to add to her inventory with this loan. In the future, she wants to improve her store by installing a roof and by offering a wider variety of food and other items, so that her customers can buy what they need. This is her tenth loan from MFP. She promises to make timely payments because she is very responsible and because she doesn't want to disappoint her work group, which has placed much faith in her. With this loan, she plans on purchasing a greater quantity of school supplies for this year. Classes have already begun, and she needs to stock up on this merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni nació en la comunidad de Cajamarca del distrito de Cachimayo y tiene 29 años. Actualmente, Marleni vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con su esposo y su hija Frinney. La ciudad de Cachimayo  se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Marleni se dedica a la venta de aretes y mochilas en el centro comercial “El Paraiso”, ella tiene un puesto de venta en el mismo centro comercial, donde la pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Marleni nos cuenta que hace 6 años vendía de forma ambulatoria pero ahora tiene un stand en el centro comercial.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Marleni que espera recibir S/. 500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar aretes. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Marleni pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Marleni was born in the community of Cajamarca in the Cachimayo district. She is 29 years old. Now Marleni lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and her daughter, Frinney. The city of Cachimayo is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Marleni sells earrings and backpacks in the "El Paraiso" shopping center. She has a stall in that same shopping center where you can find her every day of the week from 9 in the morning until 8 at night. Marleni tells us that 6 years ago she was a street vendor but now she has a stall in the shopping center. With the next loan, Marleni hopes to receive 500 Peruvian soles. She would like to use the money to buy earrings. The communal bank "Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” has been in existence for 3 and a half years. Marleni has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years, and it is going very well. The members of this group are devotees of Taytacha Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Brilliant Snow), and for this reason they have used this as the name of their communal group.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy earrings

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana nació en la comunidad D. Cajamarca del distrito D. Cachimayo y tiene 40 años. Actualmente, Juana vive en la ciudad D. misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos. La ciudad D. Cachimayo  se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.   

Juana se dedica a la venta D. chicha y también tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, donD. la pueden encontrar los 7 días D. la semana, desD. las 5 D. mañana hasta las 8 D. la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro D. pan. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Juana que espera recibir S/. 100o nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. 

El banco comunal “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio D. funcionamiento, Juana pertenece desD. hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios D. este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor D. la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Juana was born in the community of Cajamarca in the Cachimayo district. She is 40 years old. Now Juana lives in the same city with her husband and their 3 children. The city of Cachimayo is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Juana sells chicha (a traditional Peruvian corn-based beverage) and also has a grocery store, where you can find her 7 days a week from 5am until 8 at night, or until she runs out of her supply of bread. With her next loan, Juana hopes to receive 1,000 Peruvian soles. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy food such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. The communal bank “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” has been in operation for 3 and a half years. Juana has belonged to the group for 3 years, and it is going very well. The members from this place are devotees of Taytacha Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Brilliant Snow), and for this reason they used this name for their communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food such as: rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila nació en el distrito D. Zurite y tiene 60 años. Actualmente, Petronila vive en la ciudad D. Cusco junto con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. La ciudad D. Zurite se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.   

Petronila se dedica a la venta D. zapatos en el centro comercial “El Paraiso”, ella tiene un puesto D. venta en el mismo centro comercial, donD. la pueden encontrar los 7 días D. la semana, desD. las 9 D. mañana hasta las 8 D. la noche. Catalina nos cuenta que hace 6 años vendía D. forma ambulatoria pero ahora tiene un stand en el centro comercial.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Petronila que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar zapatos. 

El banco comunal “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio D. funcionamiento, Petronila pertenece desD. hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios D. este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor D. la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Petronila was born in the Zurite district, and she is 60 years old. Petronila lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and their five children. Zurite is thirty minutes from the city of Cusco. Petronila sells shoes in the “El Paraiso” (The Paradise) commercial center. She has a stand in the commercial center. She can be found there seven days a week from nine in the morning until eight at night. Petronila tells us that six years ago she sold in an itinerant manner. Now she has a stand in the commercial center. With her next loan Petronila hopes to receive 1000 soles. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy shoes. The “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” Communal Bank has been operating for three and a half years. Petronila has belonged to the communal bank for three years. It is going very well for her. The members are devotees of Taytacho Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Brilliant Snow), and for this reason they gave the bank that name.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes nació en la comunidad de Cajamarca del distrito de Cachimayo y tiene 40 años. Actualmente, Mercedes vive en la ciudad de misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos. La ciudad de Cachimayo  se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Mercedes se dedica a la venta de comestibles, donde la pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 5 de mañana hasta las 8 de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de pan. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Juana que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Mercedes pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Mercedes was born in the community of Cajamarca, in the Cachimayo district. She is now 40 years old and lives in the same area, together with her husband and her three children. The town of Cachimayo is 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Mercedes' work is selling food products. She can be found working at her business 7 days a week, from 5 in the morning until 8 in the evening, or until her bread supplies run out. With her next loan, Juana hopes to receive 1000 Peruvian new soles. She would like to use the funds from the loan to buy food products such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. The communal bank “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” has been operating for three and a half years. Mercedes has belonged to the communal bank for three years, and it is going very well for her. The members from this area are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Shining Snow), and thus they chose this name for their communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food products such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina tiene 22 años de edad, ella vive junto a su pareja y su pequeño hijo, en la casa que gracias a mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir. Desde hace 3 años brinda servicio de llamadas a celulares, para ello adquiere equipos móviles de diferentes líneas telefónicas, captando mayor cantidad de usuarios. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo pues lo realiza independientemente, además le da la ventaja de poder disponer de su tiempo para la atención de su pequeño hijo. Por otra parte lo que le resulta más tedioso es lo cansado de su trabajo pues ella debe permanecer durante largas horas, si quiere lograr los ingresos esperados. En un futuro desea contratar personas para que le ayuden a trabajar y ofrecer este servicio y así generar puesto de trabajo y mayores ingresos para su familia. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá renovar sus equipos móviles y así brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Cristina is 22, and lives together with her partner and their small son in the home that, thanks to a lot of effort, they were able to acquire. For the last 3 years she has had a cell phone calling service. For this she has had to get mobile equipment with different telephone lines so that she can have the largest number of users. She likes the work very much because she does it on her own, and she has the advantage of being able to use her time taking care of her small son. What is hard for her is how tired she gets since she has to work for many hours if she wants to get the income she hopes. In the future she would like to hire people so that they can help her with her work and offer more workstations to generate higher earnings for her family. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be prompt with all the payments. With the loan that she is requesting she will be able to refurbish the mobile equipment and thus offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish her mobile equipment

loans.name: Erick Omar

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Erick Omar F. le esta haciendo falta un baño de material ya que actual mente tiene una de madera y esta en muy mal condiciones.
Solicita el un préstamo para poder comprar el material, ya que el se encargar de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como oficial vial de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
texts.en:
The house of Erick Omar Fernandez is lacking a bathroom of solid materials, since the one he currently has is made of wood and is in very bad condition. He requests a loan so that he can buy materials; he will be in charge of making the improvements during the hours he is not at work. He plans to pay off the loan with the salary he receives from his work as a traffic officer for the city of Nuevo Laredo.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramón C. es padre de familia y tienes dos hijos de mediana edad y quiere darles la  seguridad en la casa. Pero le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas. 
Solicita un préstamo para poderle pagar a la persona que se encargara de realizar las protecciones.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleado de una escuela.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón C. is a father with two adolescent children. He wants to give them a safe environment at home, but their house lacks protection on the windows and doors. He is requesting a loan in order to pay someone to install security measures. He plans to pay off the loan with the income he receives from his work as an employee in a school.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding security to the doors and windows of his home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra conformado por varias zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Ferreñafe y se encuentra ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace diez años, el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde suele sembrar todo tipo de granos como por ejemplo maíz, Pedro depende de esta actividad para poder sustentar la economía de su familia, por lo que siempre se esfuerza trabajando diariamente para poder obtener una buena producción.

Actualmente Pedro desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y obtener una buena cosecha que le permita seguir trabajando y sosteniendo a su familia. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Pedro es un hombre responsable y bastante trabajador, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para crecer como empresario y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 42-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the Pítipo district, an agricultural area made up of several rural zones. It belongs to Ferreñafe province and lies half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Pedro has worked in agriculture for ten years. He has a small plot of farmland where he usually grows a range of basic grains, such as corn. Pedro depends on this activity to support his family, and for this reason he always works hard each day so that he can achieve good production. Currently, Pedro wants to buy fertilizers and pesticides so that he can maintain his crops and obtain a good harvest, thus allowing him to keep working and supporting his family. To achieve this aim, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles. Pedro is a responsible and very hard-working man. His greatest desire is to keep working in order to grow as an entrepreneur and provide his family with a better quality of life. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and others who know him consider him a steady and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers to maintain his corn fields

loans.name: Zhullin (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhullin está formado por 12 personas entre hombres y mujeres, viven en la comunidad de Zhullin que pertenece a la  ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por su iglesia que se encuentra en la cima de la montaña en donde está asentada la ciudad. Nuestras socias son luchadoras y trabajan muy duro día a día para ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. 

La Señora. Alexandra Elizabeth Córdova vive por el sector de Javier Loyola, es su primer crédito, fue  invitada por una vecina que pertenece a la banca comunal, se dedica a la venta de ropa en la cual lleva 5 meses, realiza sus ventas  recorriendo la ciudad de Azogues de lunes a viernes desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 5p.m.
La Señora Alexandra Elizabeth tiene 30 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en la  compra de ropa surtiendo un poco más su negocio. Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.

La Señora María Angelita B. vive en la comunidad de Zhullin, tiene 31 años, es viuda hace 8 meses, y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en la escuela,  vive en una casita en  la finca que cuida. Se dedica a la agricultura hace 10 años, en la finca tiene espacio  para criar pollo y cuyes a los cuales los vende cuando tiene  alguna necesidad en su hogar. Se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal ya que se ha retirado por un tiempo y  le hacían falta sus amigas del banco;  su crédito lo va a invertir en comprar pollos para seguir con su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia y ofrecerles a sus  hijos la mejor educación para que lleguen lejos en la vida.
texts.en:
The Zhullin Communal Bank has 12 members, consisting of both men and women, who live in the community of Zhullin in the city of Azogues. The city is known for a church that sits on top of a mountain where the area was founded. Day after day, the members struggle and work very hard to provide their children a better future.

Sra. Alexandra Elizabeth Córdova lives in the Javier Loyola sector and is receiving her first loan. She was invited by a neighbor to join the Communal Bank. Alexandra Elizabeth has been selling clothing for five months. She generates her sales by traveling throughout the city of Azogues. Her work schedule is from 8am to 5pm, Monday to Friday. Sra. Alexandra Elizabeth is 30 years old, single, and has three children (ages 14, 10, and 7). Her oldest child attends high school in the city, while her two younger children are in elementary school. She does not own a home, so she currently lives in a rental property. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing so that her business will be stocked with additional inventory. Her goal is to have her own home.

Sra. María Angelita B. lives in the community of Zhullin. She is 31 years old and has been widowed for 8 months. She has two children, ages 13 and 8. Her oldest child is in high school, while the younger one is in elementary school. María lives in a small cottage on a farm that she monitors. She has been farming for 10 years. Her farm has a space where she raises chickens and guinea pigs to sell whenever she has to cover any household needs. María is returning to the Communal Bank since she had dropped out for a period of time. She says she missed the friends she had made while she was part of the Communal Bank. Her loan will be used to buy chickens so that she can continue her business. María says her goal is to have a house of her own and provide her children with the best education so that they can go far in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and dresses

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin C. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 30 years old, married, and has one infant child. To make a living, he buys and sells coconuts in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Elvin is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be his 2nd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun M. and her husband, Mr. Nen Net, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1978 and have five daughters and three sons. One of their children is married and lives in a separate home, four are in school and the other three weave silk at home.  

Mrs. Phun M. has asked for a Kiva loan two times already. Because silk weaving is the main source of income to support Phun’s family and they do not want to change to another business, she is requesting her third loan in the amount of $150 to purchase silk materials for continuing her and her children’s silk weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Chriv

texts.en:
Mrs. Chriv M., 50, and her husband Mr. Kin Keo, 61, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have four children, one son and three daughters. One of them is married and lives in a separate home, two are in school and another one assists her mother in the business.   

Chriv sells ice and Nompang Daksach (sandwiches on baguettes) in her village. Her husband is a farmer, and he grows bananas and mangoes. She is asking for a loan of $500 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Pontod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old, married, and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like banana cue in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

Juliet is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Miss Kunthy C., pictured here with her loom, is single and lives with her niece on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a silk weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

Kunthy does not have the capital needed to purchase silk materials for her weaving business, so she is asking for a loan of $200 in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma C. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products. She also sells rice by the kilogram in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Erma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita  P. is 54 and married with 9 children (ages 14 - 32).  She owns a business venture, providing suit-making services and doing 'elei' prinitng (on cloth) for local community members.  Makerita  has many years of experience in this business.  Makerita  needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials & some paints for making the 'elei'.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2005, Makerita  joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Makerita's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials & 'elei' printing materials & paints

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Batdorj is 31 years old and lives on his brother's land in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent with his wife and two children, aged 14 and 2. 

He owns two secondhand minivans (people carriers) and got a contract with the transportation authority to carry people on two separate remote bus lines. He has been running his transportation business since 2002.  His wife works with him as a cashier. 

Batdorj is a very hardworking, optimistic person whose goal is to extend his business and provide good education for his kids. He also wants to have his own house to live in. 

In the contract, the transportation authority sets high requirements, so Batdorj is asking for this loan to buy some spare parts for his vans, such as front bumpers, batteries, doors, new door handles, headlights and some seats. He also needs to do some small body paint work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vans and do some paint work

loans.name: Gudilla

texts.en:
Gudilla S. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan, Camiguin Province. She is 61 years old. Gudilla is widowed and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Gudilla owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gudilla has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gudilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gudilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gudilla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Gudilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jessica Paola

texts.es:
La Señora. Jessica Paola T. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido vive por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su rica cultura, su centro histórico, su variada gastronomía, la belleza de su vegetación y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Señora Jessica Paola es muy joven tiene 23 años, es casada y tiene 1 hija de 4 años de edad, vive en la casa de su mamá debido que no tienen casa propia y comparten los gastos del hogar.

Trabaja como asesora de ventas de los productos personales Unilever, labora en esta actividad hace un año y ocho meses, trabaja de 9 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. de lunes a sábados; también tiene un pequeño bazar hace un año.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por una amiga que es socia del banco comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su bazar.

Su meta es  ingresar a la universidad y obtener su titulo de Ingeniera Comercial.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica Paola T. is a member of the Communal Bank “Medio Ejido”. She lives in the Las Orquídeas sector of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for its rich culture, its historical center, its various cuisines, its beautiful vegetation, and the warmth and friendliness of its people.

Sra. Jessica Paola is a young woman who is 23 years of age, married, and has a four year old daughter. Since she does not own a home, she lives at her mother’s house and shares in the household expenses.

Jessica works as a sales consultant, offering personal products manufactured by Unilever. She has had this job for a year and eight months, and works Monday through Saturday from 9am to 7pm. Jessica also has a small bazaar that she opened a year ago.

She is receiving her first loan from Fundación ESPOIR and was invited by a friend to join the Communal Bank. Her loan will be invested in merchandise for her bazaar. Jessica says her goal is to gain admission at the university and obtain a degree in Commercial Engineering.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her bazaar such as clothing, costume jewelry, gifts, cosmetics, and stationery

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark C. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 29 years old. Mark is single. To make a living, Mark owns & operates transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services locally known as "habal-habal". Mark has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mark joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mark has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mark is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Mark from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Maira Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra Maribel A. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su rica cultura, su centro histórico, su variada gastronomía, la belleza de su vegetación y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Señora. Mayra Maribel  tiene 37  años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y de 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es chofer profesional y labora manejando un camión en la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Mayra es oriunda de Zaruma y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca hace 2 años, decidido venir a esta ciudad para  cambiar de ambiente, se dedica a trabajar en su propio restaurante que  lo tiene hace 2 años, labora en él desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m., de lunes a sábado.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, el crédito anterior le  beneficio en su negocio y ahora  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres y  materiales para su negocio como ollas etc. Su meta es tener su casa propia en la ciudad de Cuenca.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra Maribel A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Medio Ejido”. She lives in the Las Orquídeas sector of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for its rich culture, its historical center, its various cuisines, its beautiful vegetation, and the warmth and friendliness of its people.

Sra. Mayra Maribel is 37 years old, married, and has two children (ages 18 and 3). Her oldest child attends high school in the city. Mayra’s husband works as a professional truck driver and travels around the city. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Mayra is originally from Zaruma, but she has been living in the city of Cuenca for two years. She decided to move to this city for a change of scenery. Mayra works in her own restaurant that she started two years ago. She works from 7am to 8pm, Monday through Saturday.

Mayra is participating in her second loan cycle. Her previous loan was a great help to her business and she will use her new loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients and supplies, such as cooking pots. Her goal is to have her own house in the city of Cuenca.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & cooking utensils

loans.name: 04.04.16 Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mai B. T. (17) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Mai is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official designation of this borrowing group is 16 (04.04.16).

Mai is married and has 2 children.  To make a living, Mai operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattL. for saL..  Mai has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mai is requesting  a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in the amount of 4.248.000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Mai plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Thoa (18) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  T. T. Nga (19) is a 66-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Mai B. T. (17) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Mai là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 16 (04.04.16).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Mai thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Mai kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Mai đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Mai đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Thoa (18) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  T. T. Nga (19) là 66 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Carmen Hermelinda

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen Hermelinda M. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su rica cultura, su centro histórico, su variada gastronomía, la belleza de su vegetación y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Señora. Carmen Hermelinda se encuentra en su segundo ciclo realizando los créditos en la fundación Espoir, se dedica a trabajar en un restaurante hace 2 años laborando desde las 9 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m. y todo el tiempo libre se dedica realizar manualidades para adornar locales para fiestas, también elabora muñecos de felpa, estas habilidades aprendió  en algunos cursos y se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años.

Doña Carmen tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 14 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive de manera independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, su última hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad.

Su  nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar sus manualidades como: cintas, silicona etc.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Hermelinda M. is a member of the Communal Bank “Medio Ejido”. She lives in the Orquídeas sector of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for its rich culture, its historical center, its various cuisines, its beautiful vegetation, and the warmth and friendliness of its people.

Sra. Carmen Hermelinda is participating in her second loan cycle with Fundación ESPOIR. She has been working at a restaurant for two years, where her schedule is from 9am to 4pm. During her free time she makes handmade party decorations and plush dolls. She has been making crafts for ten years and learned this skill by taking a few courses.

Doña Carmen is 39 years old, married, and has three children (ages 23, 20, and 14). Her oldest child is married and lives independently. The second child is working and helps with the household expenses. Her youngest child attends high school in the city.

Her new loan will be invested in the purchase craft materials such as ribbon, silicon, and other products. Carmen says her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, ribbons, silicon, thread, and other craft materials

loans.name: Ariungerel

texts.en:
Ariungerel D. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd, western Mongolia. He and his family have been living together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, for the last 14 years. His wife recently gave birth so she stays at home to take care of their two children.

Since 1990, Ariungerel has been working as a carpenter in his town. His business is mostly successful from spring to autumn and creates for him the opportunity of earning much profit. During this period of time, Ariungerel works hard to produce his wooden products to fill his customers' orders. He employs 3 workers and has expanded his old workplace into two large, convenient shops. 

Ariungerel hopes to enlarge his business by hiring up to 10 employees and grow his business sustainably. Ariungerel works very hard every day in order to improve his family's quality of life as well as pay his employees. He says, “My dream is to build a bigger, warmer, more comfortable shop and purchase new and modern equipment from my business profits.” He is requesting a loan of 3,450,000 MNT in order to buy timber in bulk for his business.

loans.use: To buy timber in bulk

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia C. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Herminia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling health and generic medicinal products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Herminia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios D. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Pasil, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: livestock and ice cream vending. Her husband Jesus D., who is 58 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have eight children who are between 21 and 39 years of age. Remedios joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her thirteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. With her previous loan of PHP 10,000, she was able to earn a monthly income of PHP 5,000, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, Remedios borrowed PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional livestock so that she can continue to save for the future. Remedios is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Doraliza

texts.en: Doraliza A. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Doraliza owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies and also running a mini-store in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Doraliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Doraliza plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta B. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Loreta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Loreta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
