loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie T. is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a spices & vegetables vending  business.  She lives in Prk. Gumamela, Brgy. Calumangan, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her  spices & vegetables vending  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Emilie is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she  can  stock up on her inventory of spices and buy more fresh vegetables to sell.   This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Emilie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional stock to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 50 años de edad y La socia es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia compra y vende pasto en el barrio de Berriozábal y el mercado central; La socia es padre y madre para sus menores hijos ella también tiene animales menores y de vez en cuando compra y vende para ayudarse con este negocio también, pero por este mes está dedicada solo a la venta de pasto. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pasto al por mayor.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Margarita is 50 years old and a single mother with two children. She divides her time between her household activities and running her small business. Margarita buys and sells fodder in the neighborhood of Berriozábal and at the central market. She must play the role of both father and mother to her two young children. Margarita also raises small animals, so buying and selling them helps to maintain her business. However, this month she plans to only sell fodder. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fodder in bulk.

Margarita says she is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fodder in bulk

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga M. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She lives together with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. All of her four children attend a local middle school while her husband helps out with her business.  

Battulga manages a shoe repair business which she began in 2001 in her town and which is now considered to be the biggest repair center in her town. Her business is more profitable during the cold season. 

Battulga purchased a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and two cars with her business earnings as well.  Battulga hopes to complete a new house which is in the process of construction in the yard where the family currently lives. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase fabrics and materials used in her shoe repair business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials used in her shoe repair business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora A. is from the village of Abu, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Leonora is married and has 12 children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like home-made rice cake in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mercedes Susy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Mercedes; ella tiene 25 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos la socia es natural de Yucay;  La socia comenzó con el comercio minorista, ella vende viandas (almuerzos en las diferentes obras de construcción a los obreros),  Ahora último ella se está dedicando a la artesanía, a comprar y vender; Ella se ha unido a un grupo de artesanas para que pueda formalizar este negocio y así no la molesten. La socia solicita el préstamo para compra mercadería artesanal. 

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Mercedes is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She is originally from Yucay. Mercedes sells food by bringing lunches to different construction sites to offer to the workers. Just recently she began buying and selling handicrafts. Mercedes joined a group of artisans who decided to start a business because they wanted to be independent. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy craft merchandise.

Mercedes says she is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craft merchandise to sell

loans.name: Phom

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 26, married and the mother of one lovely young child who is enrolled in school. She owns a small rattan-selling business. She always collects rattan cupboards in bulk from her nearby neighbors and then takes them to sell door-to-door in the community. Her husband assists her in selling the products. 

Recently, S. got many orders for rattan cupboards from her regular clients but she doesn’t have enough items to serve them. In order to help solve that, S. decided to seek a loan of US$ 1000 to be used to purchase additional rattan cupboards to better meet any orders from her customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional rattan cupboards for resale

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. San Juan, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and E-load/gasoline retailer businesses. Her husband Eddie C., who is 35 years old, works as a pastor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 2 children who are 6 and 8 years old. 

Rema joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rema has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 9th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use to purchase a pig, so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children, and as additional capital for her existing businesses. Rema C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase a pig to raise and more inventory for her store

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn P. is from the village of Pontod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 23 years old. Jenelyn is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Jenelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jenelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jenelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN KOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Florencia; ella tiene 36 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, La socia compra maíz para hacer chicha de jora y también tiene el negocio de la compra y venta de animales menores (cuyes y aves de corral); La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con este tipo de negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para compra maíz para hacer la chicha de jora. 

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Florencia is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Florencia is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She earns a living by operating a small business. Florencia buys corn for making “chicha de jora” (a corn-based beverage) and also buys and sells small animals such as guinea pigs and poultry. She divides her time between her household activities and managing her business. Florencia is requesting a loan to buy corn for making “chicha de jora”.

Florencia says she is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn for making "chicha de jora"

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN KOSE D. URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia D. Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 54 años D. edad y La socia es casada  y tiene 2 hijos la socia es natural D. Yucay, ella se dedica a vender almuerzos en las obras locales y refrigerios. La socia  va por todas las construcciones que se estén realizando y a la hora del almuerzo ella lleva comidas para venderles a los obreros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para la realización D. sus platos.


La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y D. este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the Communal Bank “San José D. Urubamba”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Dominga is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She is originally from Yucay. Dominga sells lunches and snacks to the local workers. She goes to all of the construction sites during the lunch hour and brings food to sell to the workers. Dominga is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

Dominga says she is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin Y., 26, was married but got divorced from her husband when her two kids were small. Both of her kids attend school and are dependent on her. Yin Y. owns a small rattan furniture-selling business. She collects rattan furniture in bulk from her nearby neighbors and then takes it to sell door-to-door in the community. Yin Y. will be used the loan she has requested to accumulate financial capital for her furniture-selling business.

loans.use: To accumulate financial capital for her furniture-sales business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica Z., a married woman who lives in Brgy. Jolomaynon, Dalaguete, Cebu, earns her living buying and selling livestock. Her husband, Jaime Z., 51, works as a tricycle driver and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 19 and 26 years old.

Veronica joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, further uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan she is requesting PHP 250000 to buy feed and stock for her business so that she can continue to save up for family and business improvements. Veronica Z. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Janett

texts.en:
Janett Q. is from the village of Pontod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Janett owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like banana kabab in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Janett joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janett is now requesting her first loan from HSPFI, worth 4,000 PHP.  She will use this money to purchase additional raw ingredients for her food stall. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an of accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Fanny; ella tiene 27 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos la socia alterna sus actividades con la compra y venta de llantas y accesorios de vehículos. La socia junto a su conyugue trabajan en este negocio dicho sea de paso les va muy bien y les ayuda en mejorar su calidad de vida. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio implementando algunas maquinas para trabajar más eficientemente.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Fanny is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She divides her time between her normal activities and her business of buying and selling tires and vehicle accessories. Fanny and her husband manage this business together and she says they have done very well. The business has helped them improve their quality of life. Fanny is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She plans to buy some machines so that the work at her business can be performed more efficiently.

Fanny says she is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase machines for her tire shop

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Santusa; ella tiene 31 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos la socia se dedica a la elaboración de chicha, ella compra maíz y lleva y procesa la chicha para la venta en su casa.  La socia solicita el préstamo para compra maíz para elaborar la chicha. 

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Santusa is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Santusa is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She prepares “chicha” (a beverage made from corn). Santusa buys the corn and brings it home to process into chicha before selling it. She is requesting a loan to buy corn for making chicha.

Santusa says she is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn for preparing "chicha"

loans.name: Carmen Sara

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen Sara L. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive por el sector de San Pedro del Cebollar, este sector es conocido por que se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y también a la agricultura.
 
La Señora. Carmen Sara tiene  38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos  de 10 y 7 años de edad que  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión electricista no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres pero de una manera independiente.
 
Doña Carmen tiene un gabinete de belleza ya que  es estilista,  trabaja hace 10 años en su propio negocio y labora desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. de lunes a sábado,  aprovecha para vender los productos de Herbalife a sus clientes y también vende en su tiempo libre,  vende estos productos  hace un año.

Es nuestra socia hace 2 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este grupo  de mujeres luchadoras, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, etc. para vender en su gabinete.

Su meta es tener su casa propia y comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Carmen Sara L. is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras." She lives in the San Pedro de Cebollar neighborhood. This neighborhood is known to have a great view of the city of Cuenca. The residents in this area work raising animals and also work in agriculture. Carmen Sara is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 7 who study in a school in the city. Her husband is a professional electrician. They don't have their own home so they live in the house of her parents, but they support themselves. Carmen has a beauty salon, as she is a hair stylist. She has worked for 10 years in her own business. She works from 8am until 9pm from Monday through Saturday. She also takes advantage of the opportunity to sell Herbalife products to her customers, and sells in her free time as well. She has been selling these products for a year. Over the last 2 years she has taken loans that have benefited her business. She was invited to join the communal bank by her sister, who is also part of this group of "fighting women." She will use this loan to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, creams, etc. to sell in her salon. Her goal is to have her own house and to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, lipsticks, eye shadow, etc.

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima lives in a small city called Borewala which is located in Punjab province in Pakistan. She lives in a three-room brick house with her husband and three children. Two of them are illiterate and her youngest daughter is studying in kindergarten. Her husband sells plastic crockery. He operates his shop in a nearby market. 
 
Fatima supports her family by doing sewing for neighborhood clients. She gets a good number of orders every month which gives her a reasonable amount of income. 

Fatima is on her 4th loan and has maintained good credit record in the past three years,  never missing any meetings. Now she has applied again for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy crockery in bulk for his shop. Fatima is hopeful that by using his 5 years of experience, her husband will be able to successfully upgrade his business and increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase crockery for reselling

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline R. is from the village of Pontod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 21 years old. Evangeline is single and has one infant child. Evangeline makes and sells specialty food products like chicken and pork barbecue in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is a widow who lives in Prk. Riverside, Brgy. Marina, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:  a general store, an E-load (cell phone minutes) retailer, and a food vending business.

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.

Her previous loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos helped her earn a monthly profit of 9,000 PHP, which increased the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing 22,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase new items for her existing businesses so that she can continue to save up the for future. 

Teresita C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Raul Vicente

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

El  socio es el Sr. Raul; el socio tiene 22 años de edad y El socio es conviviente;  El socio se  dedica a vender materiales de construcción (piedras extraídas de las canteras) El socio trabaja en este negocios desde hace 2 años. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar su capital y poder adquirir materiales.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. He lives in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. His name is Raul; he is 22 years old and has a live-in partner. His work is selling construction materials (stones extracted from quarries). He has worked in this field for the past 2 years. He is requesting a loan to increase his capital so that he can buy materials. The borrower values and appreciates the loan offered to him, and in accordance with this, he is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing his capital so that he can buy materials

loans.name: Leonarda Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN KOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra.Leonarda; ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos la socia es natural de Puno y  se dedica desde hace 14 meses al comercio minorista; ella compra al por mayor todo tipo de golosinas y los vende de forma ambulatoria en las puertas de colegios, también vende figurines y yoyos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas y aumentar su mercadería. 

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Leonarda Rosa H. P. belongs to the communal bank "San Kose de Urubamba." She lives in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. Leonarda is 35 years old and lives with a partner and her 2 children. She is originally from Puno, and she has been working in retail trade for 15 months. She buys all types of snacks and candy at wholesale and sells them on the streets at the entrances to schools. She also sells figurines and yo-yo's. She requests a loan to buy candy and increase her merchandise. Leonarda values and appreciates the loan granted, and as such she promises to make her payments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candy and increase her merchandise

loans.name: Hum

texts.en:
Hum I. is a rattan cupboard seller. She is a 40-year-old married mother of three. Two of her children are school-aged, while another is already married and works as a rattan maker. 

Since 2008, Hum I. and her husband have owned a small rattan cupboard sales point. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes it to retail door-to-door across the province. Hum I. also takes time to cultivate a rice crop during the coming rainy season. Because this season is good for planting, Hum I. is taking out her loan to pay for the fee of plowing her farmland in order to grow crops.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee for her farmland

loans.name: Rinberti

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

El  socio es el Sr. Rinberti; el socio tiene 27 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio es natural de Puno,  El socio se  dedica al comercio, él y su conyugue tiene una tienda de abarrotes y mayormente venden golosinas y stickers. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar e implementar su negocio.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. He lives in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. His name is Rinberti, and he is 27 years old. He has a live-in partner and 2 children. He is originally from Puno. His work is in retail: he and his spouse have a general store, where their best-selling products are snacks and stickers. Rinberti is requesting the loan to expand and improve his business. The borrower values and appreciates the loan offered to him, and accordingly, he is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding and improving his business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn E. is from the village of Brgy. Aggub, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Evelyn is married and has three school-aged children. Evelyn sells fruits and vegetables in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Evelyn is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia V. is from the village of Tapon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Lucia is married and has four adult children. Lucia owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like sugar-coated bananas in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Lucia is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Claudia Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora Claudia Soledad V. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, este sector es reconocido por sus parques en donde se realiza una gran variedad de eventos festivos y deportivos, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora Claudia Soledad se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 6 ciclos, beneficiándose de los créditos de la fundación en su negocio ya que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa y también de calzado, labora en esta actividad hace 16 años y solo vende sus  productos en días de ferias.
 
Doña Claudia tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su segunda hija en la escuela, su esposo es latonero (endereza las latas de los vehículos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en ropa para tener mucha más variedad. Su  meta el  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Claudia Soledad V. is a member of the "Mujeres Luchadoras" ["Striving Women"] communal bank. She lives in the Miraflores neighborhood of the city of Cuenca. This area is known for its parks, where a great variety of festivals and sporting events are held. The inhabitants raise animals and work in agriculture. Claudia Soledad has been a member of this communal bank for 6 loan cycles. The loans from the foundation have been used to benefit her business; her work is selling all kinds of clothing, as well as shoes. She has done this work for 16 years, selling her products only on market days. Claudia is 31 years old and married, with 2 children, aged 12 and 7. Her older child, a son, studies at a school in the city, and her younger child, a daughter, is in primary school. Her husband is a "latonero" (auto body repairman), and they do not have a house of their own, so they live as renters. Her new loan will be invested in clothing, so that she can offer a much greater variety. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying blouses, t-shirts, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon M. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Corazon is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily-use products in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer R. is from the village of San Pablo Proper, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 23 years old. Jenifer is married and has an infant. To make a living, Jenifer owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jenifer is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jenifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenifer is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jenifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: San Pablo Proper, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Shamim Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhter belongs to a small city called Borewala, which is located in Pakistan's Punjab province. She doesn’t have any children. She spends her time making artificial flowers to support her husband financially. She sells the flowers at a good rate to different gift shops. Her husband runs a sweetmeat and bakery shop in the market. His business is going along nicely, and Shamim is living a satisfactory financial life. Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah for her nephew, who started his sweetmeat shop a few years ago. With the loan he will buy the required items for his sweetmeat shop, such as milk, sugar, dried fruit, and flavored essence.

Shamim is very supportive and loves to help people in need. She is very hopeful that her nephew will be able to improve his business with the help of this investment. Shamim has been a regular loan user of Asasah for the last two years and has proved herself a responsible person.

loans.use: To purchase required items for a sweetmeat shop

loans.name: Soprima

texts.en:
Soprima L. has been enjoying spending the profits from her fishing business. Because of this she has able to sustain the needs of her family and has able to make quite an improvement in their lives. Because of that and the loans she can access to support her busines,s Soprima is encouraged to work harder and plan further for her business and family. 

Therefore, Soprima wants to take this opportunity to grow her business by requesting another loan of 28,000 PHP from our Kiva lenders for additional business capital. Soprima wants to maintain and support the needs of her business to catch more fish to sell as well as attracting more clients.

Her long term goals are to have a successful fishing business, to build sari-sari (variety) store that is convenient for people in the village who live far from the market place, and to support her family financially.  With the support of Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor. Soprima’s wish to offer her children a better hope fuels her pledge to her project.

The attached picture of Soprima was taken August 3, 2010 with her supportive son, Romel L..

loans.use: To maintain her fishing business

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio D. Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito D. Santiago , provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es Viuda y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con Panadería;  Ella se dedica a administrar su horno panadería; La socia es una mujer fuerte y luchadora y se hace cargo diario D. sus negocio, siendo la cabeza D. familia este negocio sigue siendo el respaldo D. sus hogar  en cuanto a la economía. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar harina, levadura y otros insumos para la panadería. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sofia belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" ("We go together") community bank and lives in the community of Arcopata, district of Santiago, province of Cusco, Peru. She is a 57-year-old widow with two children. She makes a living working daily at her bakery. She is a strong and hard-working woman who daily tends to her business, and being the head of her family the bakery is the backbone of her household finances. Sofia is requesting the loan to purchase flour, yeast and other ingredients for her bakery. She is grateful to those who help her reach her dream through these means, and she promises to fulfill her payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast and other ingredients

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio D. Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito D. Santiago , provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 55 años D. edad y es separada estudio solo la primaria y tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el servicio D. compra y venta D. llantas (para autos), Ella se dedica también al alquiler D. autos, ella alquila autos para ponerlos atrabajar prestando servicio D. taxi; La socia es una mujer pujante y llena D. muchas ganas D. prospera. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. llantas al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" ("We Go Together") community bank and lives in the community of Arcopata, district of Santiago, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 55 years old and separated from her husband, has an elementary school education and has three children. She alternates her daily activities of buying and selling tires for automobiles and renting cars to make a living. She rents the cars to put them to work for a taxi service. Rosa is thriving woman who is full of desire to prosper. She is requesting the loan to purchase tires at wholesale. She is grateful to those help her reach her dreams through these means and promises to fulfill her payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires at wholesale

loans.name: Rosa Rebeca

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Rebeca C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad con mas importante del Ecuador, fue nombrada patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999 por la UNESCO, es de clima frió y gente muy calida.

La Señora Rosa Rebeca tiene 48 años,  es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 30, 27 y 21 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive de manera independiente, su segunda hija se dedica a trabajar  y con eso solventa  sus gastos, su último hijo estudia en la  universidad, su esposo es chofer profesional  y labora en un taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos Yanbal actividad que desempeña hace 3 años, le gusta su trabajo ya que no tiene un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra trabajando con los créditos de la fundación hace 3 años los mismos que le han beneficiado en su negocio,  su crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de mas cosméticos ya que tiene pedidos por entregar.

Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) community bank and lives in the city of Cuenca, the third most important city in Ecuador that was named a UNESCO world heritage site in 1999. It has a cool climate and the people are very warm. Rosa is 48 years old, married and has three children, ages 30, 27 and 21. Her oldest son is married and lives independently; her daughter works and helps with household expenses; and her youngest son studies at a university. Her husband is a taxi driver. They do not own their own but are renting. Rosa has made a living selling cosmetics of the Yanbal product line for the past three years, and she enjoys her job because she doesn't have a fixed schedule. She has been working with loans from this foundation for the past three years, over which time her business has benefited. She plans to invest the loan in purchasing more cosmetics because she has orders to deliver. Her goal is to be able to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie I. is from the village of Brgy. Aggub, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old. Tessie is married and has five adult children. Tessie owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Tessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Tessie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tessie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia A. is 69 years old and widowed; she has only one son,  Jameson, who is 42 years old and a fisherman. She is a God-fearing and fearless mother. She and her son have helped each other to overcome the poverty that impeded their family.

In 2003, Lilia joined Kiva partner ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI in the Philippines, to acquire capital for her fishing business. As a member of ASHI for almost 8 years, she has noted good performance in her credit rating (basis of loans) and is therefore being trusted by ASHI to obtain bigger loans. For almost 8 years of her membership in ASHI, Lilia has been a model member dedicated to managing her family’s fishing operations. This loan is her 6th – she has made good use of her previous loans to expand her business and income. Lilia has applied for a new loan of 28,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to support the needs of her fishing business. Lilia dreams of expanding her business into a full-fledged fish farm. She also engages in other businesses for supplementary income.

She dreams of sending her grandson to school until he finishes college and finds a good job. Until that dream happens, Lilia is happy with the way in which ASHI and Kiva have touched her family's life and given them a good chance of making their dreams come true.

The attached picture of Lilia was taken August 03, 2010 with her supportive son, Jameson A..

loans.use: To support the needs of her fishing business.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 45-year-old lady who has been living in Borewala with her family for the last 15 years. Borewala is a small city which is located in south Punjab Pakistan.

She is the mother of two sons, both of whom are running their  own businesses. Her elder son has a business of selling cosmetics while the youngest one is operating a sewing business. 

She supports her husband financially by doing embroidery on dresses. She takes orders from nearby customers and fulfills them on time to make an income. She is good in her art and has a good reputation for her quality of work among her customers. 

Her husband is a tailor by profession. He runs his tailoring shop in the market. He can sew both gents & ladies clothes and gets a reasonable income. Due to having a tailoring business, Rukhsana gets regular orders every month and also provides her customers the services of sewing clothes as well.
  
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who will buy a sewing machine and hire an assistant to expand his income. This will enable him to fulfill larger orders in short periods of time. Rukhsana thinks that regular investment is very necessary for making a positive impact on a business. She is very confident that by using his work experience, her husband will be able to successfully upgrade his business.
 
She is in her 4th loan cycle. In the previous loan cycles she has maintained good credit and never missed single meeting.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and hire an assistant

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch V., age 26, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards. Ouch V. sells rattan that her husband weaves or that she orders from other weavers who live in the village. She uses her horse cart as transportation and it takes a week to sell all her rattan. Ouch V. has been facing difficulties transporting her rattan because her horse is getting old and doesn’t have the capacity to carry items to sell far away. Because of this obstacle, Ouch V. would like to request a Kiva loan in order to replace her old horse.

loans.use: To replace her old horse.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio D. Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito D. Santiago , provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 51  años D. edad y es casda y tiene 1 Hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista; Ella se dedica a repartir carne y otros en el molido 2 desD. hace 6 años y necesita aumentar a su capital un poco D. dinero mas para su nuevo pedido; La socia es una mujer pujante y llena D. muchas ganas D. progresar. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la mercadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dominga belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" ("We Go Together") community bank and lives in the community of Arcopata, district of Santiago, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 51 years old, married and has one son. She makes a living as a commercial retailer, offering meats and other items for the past six years, and she needs to increase her capital a bit more to cover her latest order. Domniga is a thriving woman full of desire to keep making progress. She is requesting the loan to purchase more supplies. She is grateful to those help her reach her dreams through these means and promises to fulfill her payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shirley Eneida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Shirley;  ella tiene 21 años de edad y es conviviente y  tiene 1 Hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de empleada, ella trabaja limpiando en un hotel, lleva trabajando en este hotel desde hace 1 año y le esta yendo muy bien. Ella hace la limpieza de todo el pequeño hotel, La socia ahora quiere invertir en viajar a desahuadero a traer ropa para vender de forma ambulatoriamente a sus amigas y gente conocida, ella llevara este negocio de manera paralela al que tiene. La socia  solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Shirley belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" ("We Go Together") community bank and lives in the community of Arcopata, district of Santiago, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 21 years old, lives with her partner and has one son. She has made a living working cleaning a hotel for the past year, and it has gone very well. She does the cleaning for all of the small hotel. She now wants to invest in traveling to Desahuadero to bring back clothes she can sell to her friends and acquaintances. She will carry out this business along with her current job. She is requesting the loan to purchase the clothing. She is grateful to those who help her reach her dreams through these means and promises to fulfill her payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Madelyn's Group

texts.en:
Madelyn B. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. She is 45 years old and the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Madelyn B.. Madelyn is married and has five school-aged children. Her main source of income comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in the business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP when she sells a grown animal.

In 2010, Madelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Madelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell

loans.name: Eunice Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Milagros; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con varias actividades, Ella se dedica a repartir aceite, también tiene su puesto de venta anticuchos y venta de ponches calientes para las noches frías; La socia es una mujer muy optimista y súper emprendedora ella está en todo y arriesgándose a todo, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus dos actividades (negocios).

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “VAMOS JUNTOS” (Let's go together) communal bank; the member lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, in the Santiago district, in the Cusco province and department. The member is Mrs Milagros; she is 29 years old and lives with her partner and has 2 children; The member alternates her daily activities with different activities, she delivers oil, also she has a stall selling kebabs and warm punch for the cold nights; The member is a very optimistic woman and very entrepeneurial she is into everything and takes a chance on everything, The member is asking for a loan to invest in her two businesses. The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means and promises to complete the payment of her installments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to invest in her two businesses.

El socio es la Sr. Rosendo; el tiene 63  años de edad y es viudo  tiene3 Hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista, desde hace 11 años, El socio se dedica a la venta de productos secos y los envía a Puerto Maldonado; El socio es solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su envío.

Rosendo is 63 years old and a widower with three children. He’s been alternating his daily activities between small businesses for the past 11 years, selling dry goods, which he ships to Puerto Maldonado. He is asking for this loan in order to invest in merchandise to ship. He is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and he is committed to making his payments on time.

La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar los cds y sus cajitas, y en comprar las pinturas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. She lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Natividad is 28 years old, lives with her life partner and two children. She is a multifaceted woman. Among her business activities, she sells cosmetics on foot and also cleans offices for a local finance company. On the weekends she sells CDs in the Huachac Plaza. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy CDs, CD cases, and cosmetics. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en consultorio dental en casa. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. She lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Ana is 25 years old, lives with her life partner and her son, and works as an orthodontist assistant, having studied and graduated from a technical dental school. She provides prosthetics for dentists and supports dentists in general, from an office in her home. She wants to expand her office, and also buy some supplies. She is asking for this loan so that she can invest in her home office. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Silvia

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

Silvia; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de empleada en una notaria muy conocida en la ciudad, La socia desea arreglar y mejorar su casa, ella quiere comprar unos cuantos muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de algunos muebles para su casa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. She lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Silvia is 33 years old, lives with her life partner and her two children, and works for a well-known notary in the city. She wants to repair and improve her home and also buy a few pieces of furniture, and is asking for this loan in order to buy the furniture. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furniture

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en: Mussarat has spent her life in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. She is a housewife who spends most of her time taking care of her home and family. She has two daughters who are getting their education. The elder one is in sixth grade and the younger one is in kindergarten. Her husband has a cigarette-selling business, buying the cigarettes in the city of Peshawar and selling them from a stall which he rents in Borewala’s busy market. Mussarat's husband wants to operate his business on a larger scale by renting an adjacent shop but he has to pay a big advance up front, so Mussarat has applied for a loan from Asasah for this purpose. With the loan amount her husband will pay the advance on the shop and buy cigarettes of different brands in larger quantities. He has 8 years of experience in this field and Mussarat is hopeful that he will be able to increase his income in this way. Mussarat is receiving a loan for the second time. Earlier, she invested the loan amount in the expansion of her husband’s business, which has earned him a good income.

loans.use: Pay the advance rent on a cigarette store

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo P. is 44 and lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where he earns a living as a construction laborer. He is also hired by people to construct buildings. Besides his job, Keo P. and his wife take the time to cultivate rice crops on their own farmland. The couple has been married for years and have five children. One of the children helps support her family by working in the garment industry, while the other four go to school. The family living situation is not comfortable because their house is old and often needs repairs. Because of that, Keo P. has decided to pursue a loan in the amount of $600 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, in order to mend their old house.

loans.use: To mend their old house.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Adelaida; ella tiene 33  años de edad y es casada tiene 2  Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de lavandera, ella estudio la secundaria incompleta, La socia también vende productos de belleza por catalogo y tenerlos en reserva para sus futuras ventas, ella aprovecha cada oferta y las compra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza por catálogos. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. She lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Adelaida is 33 years old, married and has 2 children. She did not complete junior high school and works as a washerwoman. She also sells beauty products through a catalog and keeps some on hand for future sales. She takes advantage of every special offer when she buys them. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy more beauty products to keep on hand. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

Marianela; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio ambulatorio minorista, Ella se dedica a  vender pinturas desde hace 6 años en las ferias o en distintos puntos de aglomeración de personas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en mercadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Marianela is 32 years old and the single mother of 2 children. She sells cosmetics and has been doing so for six years. She sells at the local fairs and at various locations where people gather. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in more merchandise. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.name: Robina Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Robina Kousar lives in the small city of Borewala in south Punjab, Pakistan. She is a thirty-year-old lady with a daughter in sixth grade. Her husband is a carpenter who not only makes furniture on order, but also has a furniture showroom in the market where he displays his handmade furniture such as bed sets, tables and chairs. He has been in this business for over 20 years and understands about different trends in the city. Robina is a housewife. She wants to support her husband financially in his business which is why she has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy wood in larger quantities to execute larger orders on time. Robina is very confident that her husband has the ability to improve his business by making positive use of the loan. 
This is the first time she has applied for a microfinance loan and she hopes that it will be profitable.

loans.use: Purchase wood in larger quantities to make furniture

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:

La socia es la Sra. Presentacion; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la picantería, Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas, ella tiene un restaurante típico tradicional, La socia cocina a leña, también vende chicha de maíz amarrillo, llamada bebida de los inkas; La socia tiene este su negocio desde hace 12 años. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vajilla, carne y otros para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. She lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Presentacion is 55 years old, is married and has 2 children. She cooks and sells typical traditional foods from her restaurant, where she cooks from a wood fired stove. She also sells “Chicha,” (a fermented drink) made from yellow corn. Chicha is known as the drink of the Incas. She has had this business for 12 years and is asking for this loan in order to invest in tableware, meat, and other items for her business. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar los materiales para hacer pinturas.

She and her partner paint different landscapes and sell them at fairs on the weekend. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in painting supplies. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Vilma is 40 years old, is married and has three children. She works as a secretary for an important company, but also makes delicious delicacies (yogurt) in her home, and sells them to her co-workers. In this way she ears an extra income. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in her home business. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.
